properties.circumstances: Francisco Villicana was cleaning his personal gun when he mistakenly fired the single round that killed Luis Alfredo Ferro-Sanchez.

properties.name: Aaron Linke
properties.circumstances: Police were conducting a search warrant. Police allege when they entered the home they heard a gunshot. Police allege they encountered the victim who allegedly pointed a gun at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jorge Arias
properties.circumstances: During a training exercise, an off-duty officer failed to switch from his real gun to his training gun. He then shot and killed the victim during a training exercise.

properties.name: Jason Smith
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to a domestic disturbance involving a gun. Police allege when they arrive, the vicim would not negotiate and was armed. Police allege the victim pointed a gun at them, who then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Thomas Christopher Wheeler
properties.agency_responsible: Easley Police Department,Pickens County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Police responded to an alleged fight. Police allege when they arrive, the victim fled and carjacked a vehicle. Police allege he then crashed into an embankment. Police allege he pointed a gun a police who then sho and killed the victim.

properties.name: Mark Edward Evers
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a mental health call. When the mental health deputy arrived, he alleged the victim was uncooperative. The deputy allegedly tried to take the victim in for an emergency order of detention. Police allege the victim shot the deputy, who then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Vincent Martinez
properties.circumstances: Officers received call that the victim was allegedly involved in a domestic assault and a hostage situation. Officers arrived and attempted to negotiate with the victim. After a while,  police allege he left the apartment with a weapon and the hostage. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Derrick Weatherspoon
properties.circumstances: Officers received a 911 call about a man allegedly armed with a gun at a taco shop. When they arrived, the victim allegedly came out and fired at the officers, who then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jason Thorpe
properties.circumstances: Police allege the victim fired at the police station. Police allege they attempted to negotiate with the victim, but the victim allegedly refused. Police allege he ran toward police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police received a call regarding an unwanted person at a home. When officers arrived, they allege that victim opened fire on them, they then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Wilma Taft
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a call by victim regarding a domestic dispute. When police arrived victim was allegedly holding a gun. Officers claim she refused to put it down at which point they shot and killed her.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Officers identified the man as a person of interest in a murder incident and visually located him.  They pulled him over, which is when police allege he pointed a gun at them. Chief Brandon said four officers then shot the man. He later died at the hospital.

properties.name: Christopher Blount
properties.circumstances: Officers were called for a disturbance. Police allege victim was combative and a deputy used his taser on the victim. Police allege the victim became unresponsive and died a short time later.

properties.name: Angel Jimenez
properties.circumstances: Police allege they conducted a traffic stop on the victim and the victim fled. Police allege the victim had a gun and did not comply. Police allege the victim turned toward police, police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Sergio Gruver
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a report of the victim allegedly threatening family members. When police arrived, they allege the victim was holding a knife. Police allege he began to approach them with the knife, at which point they shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Joel Capellan
properties.circumstances: Police alleged they observed the victim armed in a fight with someone. Police allege the victim refused to drop the gun. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Taylor Grimes
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to an alleged domestic disturbance. Police allege when they arrived, the victim opened the door with a gun. Police allegedly attempted to negotiate with police  After a stand-off victim came to the open door and allegedly aimed gun at police who shot him.

properties.name: Nelson Amos
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call indicating they had heard gunfire on the victim's property. Responding police encountered victim allegedly driving a tractor and holding a weapon. After multiple attempts of communication, the victim allegedly pointed his firearm at officers who shot him.

properties.name: Quantaze Campbell
properties.circumstances: Police allege that they spotted a stolen vehicle and made contact with the victim. Police allege that the suspect refused orders to park and stay in the vehicle. He allegedly accelerated toward the officer. The officer shot him..

properties.name: Christopher Ardoin
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging a man naked and waving a gun in the street.  It is unclear what led police to shooting the victim, but police shot the victim before he fled inside a home. Police allege when they went inside the home, the victim was dead.

properties.name: Taylor L. Lowery
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a domestic incident. Police allege the victim left the residence and drove to area store where police claim he tried to carjack a woman with a knife. Police intervened and after the victim allegedly refused to drop the knife and moved towards officers, 5 officers fired their weapons killing victim.

properties.name: Jeffery Smith
properties.circumstances: Officers called to scene where a man was reportedly assaulted by someone and who had fled the scene. Officers allege the victim ran into the woods and police attempted negotiations with the victim. Police allege the victim fired his weapon at which time police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jamontey O. Neal
properties.circumstances: During traffic stop victim allegedly begins shooting at officers who shot him.

properties.name: Raheem Lee
properties.circumstances: Police were serving a warrant for the victim for a previous incident. Police allege the victim began shooting. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Nicholas Brutcher
properties.circumstances: Victim allegedly called 911 to lure police to the residence. Once police arrived, victim allegedly opened fire, killing two officer and wounding a third. The wounded officer shot and killed victim.

properties.name: Joseph Bestick Jr.
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a wellness check. When police responded, they allege the victim reached for a gun and shot himself. An officer then shot the victim as well.

properties.name: Jason Sanderson
properties.circumstances: Officers were pursuing the victim who was driving a stolen vehicle. The victim allegedly crashed the vehicle and proceeded run away. Officers pursued the victim and allegedly the victim pointed a semi-automatic pistol and fired upon officers. Law enforcement fired upon the victim. LAFD paramedics pronounced the victim deceased at the incident.

properties.name: Hui Zhang
properties.circumstances: Following a car crash, the driver allegedly ran from the scene.  The officer followed on foot and allege the victim was armed (though it was an imitation gun). The officer then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Daniel Francis Scott
properties.circumstances: Officers were called due to the victim allegedly refusing to leave a business as it closed. When officers arrived they allege the victim swung a machete and charged at an officer. The officer then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Christopher Earl Smith
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to call about a man allegedly aiming a gun at people. Police allege when they located the victim he allegedly pulled a firearm from his waistband. Police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.agency_responsible: McIntosh County Sheriff's Department,Checotah Police Department
properties.circumstances: A deputy stopped the victim’s vehicle for an alleged traffic violation, during which the victim stopped but then drove away, leading deputies in a chase. The victim allegedly drove erratically and sideswiped law enforcement vehicles before driving off the shoulder. The victim attempted to flee, but allegedly turned around with a gun. Law enforcement allege that there was an exchange of gunfire and the victim was pronounced deceased at the scene.

properties.name: Terry Hinton
properties.circumstances: Officer was driving while on duty and hit and killed victim, who lived on the same road.

properties.name: Johnny Devin James
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to an EMS request for assistance. Police allege the victim was in the front yard with a machete and allegedly refused to drop it. The victim allegedly approached the officer with the machete raised when the officer shot and killed him.

properties.name: Bryar Everett Wolfe
properties.circumstances: Police located the victim who was allegedly involved in a previous incident. Police allege the victim shot at police and then fled. Police allege he began firing at police again, police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: David Arnold
properties.agency_responsible: Calaveras County Sheriff's Office,Tuolumne County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to reports alleging shots fired.  When police arrived, they allege the victim began firing at them. After several hours of negotiation, police allege the victim began shooting at officers again. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Stephaun Jones
properties.agency_responsible: Fairfax County Sheriff's Office,Hamilton Township Police Department
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging someone fled from a crash and had shot someone. Police allege the victim fled and was confronted by police. Police allege the victim showed a gun and was then shot and killed by police.

properties.name: Thomas Henzler
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging the victim was shooting the ceiling and preparing to ambush law enforcement. Police allege when they arrived, the victim walked toward deputies at which time police shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Christopher Allen Boggess
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to the scene of someone allegedly aiming a gun at someone.  When police arrived, they allege the victim began walking toward police and pulled out a gun. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Dexton Bolden
properties.agency_responsible: Georgia State Patrol,Clayton County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Officers stopped a vehicle in connection to a homicide investigation. The victim initially pulled over but allegedly drove away as law enforcement approached the vehicle. Law enforcement employed a PIT maneuver and stopped the vehicle. The victim was allegedly not cooperative and they sent in a k-9 into the victim's vehicle and the victim allegedly fired on the k-9. Law enforcement allege there was an exchange of gunfire with the victim. The victim was pronounced deceased at the scene.

properties.name: Jaheim McMillan
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call alleging people were aiming guns at cars. When police arrived, they allege the victim did not comply and pointed  a gun at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jonas Drew Gonzales
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to an alleged domestic disturbance. When police arrived, they allegedly found the victim threatening another person. Police allege the victim began moving toward the other person with a gun. An officer then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Ronald Dunigan Burdine
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call of shots fired.  When police arrived  and began assisting someone, they allege the victim exited a trailer and shot at the officer. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Ron Welch
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a report of two people shot. When police arrived, they allegedly found the victim. Police have not disclosed what led to officers shooting the victim and have only stated they were "forced to discharge their weapons."

properties.name: Bobby Johnston
properties.agency_responsible: Claremore Police Department,Rogers County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call of a stolen vehicle. When police located the vehicle, the victim allegedly fled. Police allege the victim then came toward police in a "threatening manner." It is unclear if the victim was armed, but police shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jeremy McCracken
properties.circumstances: Police were enforcing a zoning law violation when the victim allegedly began shooting at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Troy Garcia
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a burglary call. When police arrived, they allegedly found the victim armed.  Police allege the victim would not drop the gun and police shot him.

properties.name: Manuel Gonzalez-Moran
properties.circumstances: Victim was arrested trying to cross the border form Mexico. Once at the border patrol station, victim allegedly picked up an "edged weapon" off a desk and refused to drop it. Officers claim to use a taser which didn't work, at which point they shot victim, killing him.

properties.name: Colin West
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to a call from the victim experiencing a mental health crisis. Police allege the victim was armed with a gun and refused to come out. It is unclear if the victim fired at police, but police shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Terrence Robinson
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to reports of shots fired at the victim's home, and noticing several stolen vehicles, returned the following morning with a warrant. The victim allegedly threatened and then shot at police, at which point 2 police officers returned fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Blane Lane
properties.circumstances: Police were at a residence attempting an unrelated arrest of a suspect when that suspect drew a BB gun. Officers opened fire on the suspect and inadvertently shot and killed the victim, another police officer, who was posted outside the home.

properties.name: Gary DeSanctis
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports alleging a man with a gun. Police allege when they arrived, the victim was driving away but then stopped, exited the vehicle and allegedly pointed the gun at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Samuel Vincent Richmond
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging the victim was in a mental health crisis and discussing suicide. Police also responded to two shotspotter alerts near a park. When police arrived, they allege the victim pointed a gun at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Thomas Talley
properties.circumstances: Police and SWAT responded to reports that the victim was allegedly holding a woman hostage inside her home. Officers report hearing shots, after which they entered the room where the hostage was held and shot the victim, killing him.

properties.name: Antonio Calmese
properties.circumstances: Officers on patrol were reportedly flagged down by a person saying that someone had pointed a gun at them. Police then spotted someone they say matched the description, and attempted to arrest that person (the victim). The victim allegedly fled, and officers tried to tase them, but failed to stop them leaving. Police then allege that the victim shot at them. Police shot and killed the vicitm.

properties.name: Porter Burks
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call from the victim's family regarding a mental health crisis. When police arrived, they allegedly found the victim carrying a knife and he allegedly refused to comply. Police allege he lunged at officers who then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Michael Scott Blanck
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call regarding a broken window and suspected burglary. Officers report that while on scene investigating, they encountered the victim, who allegedly drew a gun and aimed at officers (accounts differ as to whether he fired his weapon). Police responded by shooting and killing the victim.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.agency_responsible: Arapahoe County Sheriff's Office,Aurora CO Police Department
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call about a man allegedly armed with a knife. Police followed the man on to a bus, deploying a police dog and taser and forcing the man to exit the bus, where two officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: Carl J. Carrell
properties.circumstances: Police came into contact with a man (the victim) who had a warrant out for his arrest. Police claim they approached him and he fled. When police boxed his vehicle in, victim allegedly shot one of the officers at which time, another officer fired back striking him in the head and killing the victim.

properties.name: Abel Yohannes
properties.circumstances: Officers tried to stop a car they believed was involved in a robbery, they claim the car sped away, and the chase ended several miles away in a crash. The driver (victim) allegedly got out of the car with a gun which caused the officers to fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Bobby Roy Farthing
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to a report of a hostage situation. When they arrived they found the victim in a car with his adult son, allegedly holding him hostage with a firearm. Deputies claim the victim refused all de-escalation measures, after which the police shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jason Kilduff
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a 911 call for an assault. When police arrived the victim was in his pickup and attempted to strike the police with his vehicle. One officer was injured, and officers opened fire.

properties.name: Broderick Dunn
properties.circumstances: Victim was the driver in a car that was allegedly speeding. The officer performed a PIT maneuver during which the victim was not wearing a seatbelt and was ejected from the car onto the highway where he was pronounced deceased.

properties.name: Amarion Clotter
properties.circumstances: Victim was a passenger in a car that was allegedly speeding. The officer performed a PIT maneuver during which the victim was not wearing a seatbelt and was ejected from the car onto the highway where he was pronounced deceased.

properties.name: Anthony Geovany Lainez
properties.circumstances: Victim was wanted in connection to a homicide. He allegedly led police on a chase in which he was involved in an accident, attempted to flee and carjack another vehicle, while allegedly firing at police. Officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: David Gerard Jones
properties.circumstances: Officers encountered a fugitive while investigating another matter.  The victim allegedly fled in a vehicle and crashed into an officers unit. Victim allegedly proceeded to exit the vehicle and exchanged fire with police. Victim was pronounced dead at the scene.

properties.name: Jaime Naranjo Bautista
properties.circumstances: Victim's wife called police saying victim was suicidal. Police arrived and spoke to wife outside the home when victim allegedly approached with a machete and refused to put it down. Police allege victim raised machete over his head and continued walking towards officer, who then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Darrell Hibbard
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call reporting that there was an armed individual   waving around pointing at cars.  When they arrived they attempted to have the victim drop his weapon.  The victim then allegedly pointed the weapon at police and police fired on the victim.

properties.name: Daniel Joseph Sangrey
properties.agency_responsible: Great Falls Police Department,US Marshals,Montana Probation and Parole
properties.circumstances: A taskforce investigating the victim was searching for the victim on a no-bond warrant for his arrest. The victim allegedly fled on foot with a weapon.  The foot chase ended with an officer-involved shooting.  No further details.

properties.name: Terrance Maurice Sligh
properties.circumstances: Police were serving an "unlawful communication" warrant on the victim for calling and sending threatening text messages to his ex-girlfriend. Police obtained a warrant and when they arrived to serve the warrant, the victim fled via vehicle which ended in an officer involved shooting.

properties.name: Everett M. Martin
properties.circumstances: Deputies called to a home where a woman was hiding because a man (the victim) was there violating a protection order. When deputies confronted the victim, he allegedly fired a gun at them, they returned fire killing him.

properties.name: Lee Roy Villarreal
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a 911 call about a man doing "donuts" with his vehicle in an open field by a middle school. There was another report that a man entered a nearby residence and was highly intoxicated and that the person said "if police are called, he's ready for them." The victim returned to his vehicle and barricaded himself. Accounts by police are conflicting with bystanders who said that the victim was afraid to come out of the vehicle due to the number of surrounding officers. Victim left the vehicle and was shot "more than 30 times." Victim was pronounced dead. Police report that it was a "suicide by cop" but family report that this was not the case.

properties.name: Anthony John Graziano
properties.circumstances: Victim was wanted for allegedly murdering his daughter's mother. After getting reports of vehicle matching the amber alert, a chase ensued during which the victim allegedly shot at police cars and they returned fire. After the vehicle was disabled, the daughter ran towards officer who shot and killed her, and then killed the victim during an alleged firefight.

properties.name: Savannah Graziano
properties.circumstances: Victim was with her father when he murdered her mother. An amber alert was issued, but it is unclear if victim was abducted by her father or went willingly. Police identified her father's vehicle which started a chase with both parties allegedly shooting at each other. It is also not clear what role victim played in this. Once the vehicle was disabled, the victim exited the vehicle wearing tactical gear and ran towards officers who shot and killed her.

properties.name: Jesús Iván Sepúlveda
properties.circumstances: Off-duty ICE warden and brother shot 2 victims who had crossed the border into the US.  One victim died; the 2nd hospitalized. The victim was attempting to be reunited with his wife and child in Austin.

properties.name: Jose Villanueva
properties.circumstances: Deputies responding to reports of a suspicious person with a firearm.  When police arrived, they allege the victim refused to put down his weapon. Police allege the victim pointed the gun at police and was shot and killed by police.

properties.name: Jason Charles Dunkel
properties.circumstances: Officers were called for a report of a suspicious man in a bar. Police claim the victim fled on foot and attempted to get into a business on the street. When they approached him, the victim allegedly shot and struck a police officer who shot and killed victim.

properties.name: Raymond Berry Twork II
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to calls alleging a domestic disturbance. When police arrived, they allege the victim was armed. Police have not released details on what led to the police shooting and killing the victim.

properties.name: Jebb Muir
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call of a man allegedly armed with a gun and making threats. On arrival, victim is alleged to have fired at officers as they were getting out of the car. Officers returned fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Leroy Quick, Jr
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging a domestic disturbance. When an officer arrived, they allege the garage was on fire and he began to put the fire out. Police allege the victim emerged and began shooting at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jaylen Lewis
properties.circumstances: Police allegedly attempted a traffic stop on the victim. It is unclear what led to the police shooting. The victim was shot and killed while inside his vehicle.

properties.name: Ali Osman
properties.circumstances: The victim was allegedly throwing rocks into an intersection and struck police vehicles. Officers commanded the victim to stop, and shot and killed him when he disobeyed and attempted to throw another rock.

properties.name: Timothy W. Shafer
properties.agency_responsible: Christian County Sheriff's Department,Nixa Police Department,Ozark Police Department
properties.circumstances: The victim (driving) and another victim in the car were being pursued by police, after officers allege they suspected impaired driving. The chase ended when the victim's vehicle was brought to a stop with a police tactical maneuver. Once stopped, the victim allegedly drew a weapon and officers opened fire, killing both victims.

properties.name: Donna M. Bailey
properties.agency_responsible: Christian County Sheriff's Department,Nixa Police Department,Ozark Police Department
properties.circumstances: The victim and another victim (driving) in the car were being pursued by police, after officers allege they suspected impaired driving. The chase ended when the victim's vehicle was brought to a stop with a police tactical maneuver. Once stopped, the other victim in the car allegedly drew a weapon and officers opened fire, killing both victims.

properties.name: Marlon Bonds
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to an alleged burglary.  As officers searched the vehicle, they allege another vehicle approached and hit an officer.  The victim then got out of the second car and allegedly approached officers with a knife. Police then shot and killed the victim. Police allege the victim was not related to the initial burglary call.

properties.name: Darin Dyer
properties.circumstances: Officers were called for a possible burglary. The victim was in his backyard with a rifle. After a brief conversation, victim started walking back towards the house, he turned when the officer said something and was then shot and killed by the officer.

properties.name: Henry Wilson Mercer
properties.circumstances: Officers attempt to pull over a man with an outstanding warrant.  A chase ensued and a roadblock was setup. The victim allegedly increased their speed as they approached the roadblock and reportedly directed their vehicle toward a standing officer. Another officer shot the victim, who then crashed and died.

properties.name: Timothy Colin Connor
properties.circumstances: Deputies were investigating a hit and run. While locating the vehicle, they determined that the owner of the vehicle was wanted on a warrant. They attempted to arrest the victim but he allegedly fled. When he returned later, he crashed his vehicle and was confronted by deputies. Police allege the victim drew a weapon, and deputies shot and killed him.

properties.name: Antonio Gonzales
properties.circumstances: Police were called to a domestic disturbance where the accused (the victim) allegedly was carrying a gun. Upon arrival the victim allegedly spoke of suicide. After a standoff, the victim allegedly reached for his gun and officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: Darian Patrick Fisher
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging an 18-wheeler driver was shot. Police allege the victim fled in the truck. Police allege the victim then exited the vehicle and shot at them. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Federal law enforcement agents were at a residence interviewing someone in response to a call of domestic violence. During the interview, the suspect allegedly arrived home and shot and killed the person being interviewed and wounded an officer. He allegedly fled to a second location, and was located by officers. Upon engaging the victim, they allege that he immediately shot at those officers, who returned fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Amado Ramos
properties.circumstances: Police attempted to stop the victim's vehicle before the victim reportedly fled, leading police on a chase. The victim exited his vehicle and ran into a cornfield before an altercation with officers in which police shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Terris Vincent Hetland
properties.agency_responsible: Sequim Police Department,Clallam County Sheriff's Department
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a domestic violence call and reported hearing gunshots from inside the building/residence. Police allege that shots were directed at them outside, and allege the victim exited the building and shot at police. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Berlin Gonzalez
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call alleging a domestic violence incident. When police arrived, they allege the victim fired a gun at them. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Doris Jean Taylor
properties.circumstances: Police responded to the victim's home for a possible suicidal situation. When police arrived, they allege the victim had a gun. Police allege the victim walked toward them holding the gun, and was then shot and killed.

properties.name: Arlo Campbell
properties.circumstances: Officer pursuit of the victim ended in a shooting where the victim died.

properties.name: Rock Jordan
properties.agency_responsible: Oregon State Police,Josephine County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to an emergency call from a woman indicating having been kidnapped and pointed a gun at her. As police prepared to engage the suspect, the woman was shot by the victim, who then allegedly got in a vehicle and attempted to drive away. The victim allegedly fired multiple shots at officers before a police car rammed his vehicle, and police shot and killed him.

properties.name: Colby Atkins
properties.circumstances: Deputies were alerted to a crash and a man passed out in a car. Deputies woke the victim and he allegedly drove away, reportedly striking multiple police vehicles. During the pursuit, the victim allegedly ran into multiple civilian vehicle before crashing. The victim allegedly struggled in his vehicle, exiting and re-entering it multiple times, before officers allege he emerged with what looked like a weapon. Police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Bryan Coupal
properties.circumstances: Officers responding to a report of a suicidal person with access to firearms. Officers spoke with the victim, before the victim retreated inside and retrieved a firearm and allegedly aimed it at an officer, who shot and killed him.

properties.name: Mark Barrett Caldwell
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call reporting suspicious activity, and observed an armed suspect fleeing upon arrival. While looking for the suspect in the surrounding neighborhood police made contact with the victim, who was armed and standing on his own property. During the encounter the victim was shot by the officer, and died days later.

properties.name: Martin Camacho
properties.circumstances: Officers respond to a domestic violence incident. When they arrived they encounter the victim who allegedly tried running away and pulled out a gun before police shot and killed him.

properties.name: Alejandro Vitela
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to calls about an individual with multiple outstanding warrants. They identified and stopped the victim as a suspect, who was riding his bike. The victim allegedly refused to engage with officers. After a physical altercation, where police allege victim said that he was armed, an officer shot and killed him after a sudden move.

properties.name: Jeremiah James Johnson
properties.agency_responsible: Umatilla Tribal Police Department,Pendleton Police Department
properties.circumstances: Officers responding to a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival the victim was allegedly armed and during confrontation officers shot him.

properties.name: Rito Paul Morales
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to reports of gunshots in a residential area. When they arrived they observed the victim, who allegedly armed and verbally indicated that there were dead people in the home. He then allegedly pointed a gun at his own head, before allegedly then pointing a gun at officers, who shot and killed him.

properties.name: Luis Herrera

properties.name: Russell Dufault
properties.agency_responsible: Rhode Island State Police Violent Fugitive Task Force,U.S. Marshal Service
properties.circumstances: Officers approached the victim with a warrant. The victim allegedly attempted to flee in his car, hitting both officers, at which point the officers opened fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Manuel Moreno
properties.circumstances: Evans officers were dispatched on a welfare check for a man wandering around and allegedly armed with a gun. Officers reported they found the victim and allegedly attempted to de-escalate for more than 1 hour. The victim allegedly refused to cooperate with the officers' commands, and they deployed less lethal weapons when the victim started to point the firearm towards himself. Police allege that the victim pointed the weapon towards them and they shot the victim.  Victim died as result of shooting at the hospital.

properties.name: Frank Robles
properties.circumstances: Victim's vehicle had crashed into another vehicle. Police officers respond to calls and found victim in his vehicle holding a knife and presenting with cuts on his wrists. They allege that victim indicated he was 'not okay' and approached officers while holding the knife. Officer then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: William Robert Brink
properties.agency_responsible: Somerset County Sheriff’s Office,Maryland State Police
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about an armed robbery at a business. Police identified the victim and believed they matched the description. Upon engaging with him. police allege that the victim exchanged fire with them before fleeing to a nearby field. Police allege that when the victim was found again, he reportedly exchanged fire with officers, when he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Herman Whitfield III
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call about a man having a mental health crisis. Upon arrival, the man's father asked for an ambulance. The police engaged the man, who was visibly disoriented and having trouble understanding police. As the victim later moved throughout the house, police deployed their Tasers multiple times, then then handcuffed him and restrained him using their bodyweight. The victim was pronounced dead soon after.

properties.name: Micaiah Clinton
properties.circumstances: Officers identified the victim at an area business as someone with multiple warrants. Police gathered to arrest him when they allege he barricaded himself in his van. Police tried multiple non-lethal means to get him to exit the vehicle. He later exited the vehicle allegedly armed and shooting at police. The victim was killed in the exchange of gunfire.

properties.name: Ernesto Drew Pena
properties.circumstances: Officers initiated a traffic stop for an unreleased reason. While engaging the driver, the victim allegedly allegedly brandished a gun. One of the officers fired a shot that hit the victim, killing him.

properties.name: Kelvin Armstrong
properties.circumstances: Police responded to calls about an armed suspect demanding keys to a vehicle at an area business. The victim allegedly was just pulling away as officers arrived. Police pursued and disabled the vehicle with spike strips. Victim allegedly got out of the car, ran and pointed a gun at officers who shot and killed him.

properties.name: Rhett Thibodeaux
properties.circumstances: Deputies identified a stolen vehicle on a highway and attempted a traffic stop. They allege that the victim fled in the car and eventually stopped. Once stopped, officers allege that the victim reversed into the deputies' car. Shots were then fired at the driver, killing him.

properties.name: Erica Graham
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call of a reported shooting. Upon arrival, law enforcement allege that the victim was armed with a firearm, dressed as a police officer, and was banging the firearm on a doorframe. Officers allege that the victim did not comply with commands to drop the firearm. Police allege that the victim then pointed the handgun towards officers before they shot and killed her.

properties.name: John Raymond Fauver
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call about a suicidal man who may have a long gun. After a search and speaking with the man over the phone, police engaged with the victim while he was inside his truck. At some point the victim got out of the truck and police allege that he then pointed a long object at officers, which was later identified as a walking cane. Officers then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Clifford Jones
properties.circumstances: An off-duty police officer hit and killed the victim on a sidewalk. The officer is alleged to have been intoxicated at the time of killing the victim.

properties.name: William Houseworth II
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a hotel to investigate a domestic violence incident. They identified the suspect and, once engaged. they allege he advanced on officers while holding a knife. A taser was deployed, then an officer shot and killed him.

properties.name: Kevin Mahan
properties.circumstances: Police received a call about a mentally ill man cutting power to nearby homes and another call where the victim was vandalizing homes. They could not locate the victim initially but then received a later call. Police found the man and they allege he raised the hatchet and officers shot and killed.

properties.name: Jeffrie Ray Glover Jr
properties.circumstances: An officer responded to a call about a child custody dispute at the location and attempted to de-escalate the situation. After some sort of escalation, the officer tased the victim, who then allegedly attacked the officer. The officer alleges the victim began choking him and then reaching for their weapons belt. The officer then pulled his gun and shot him.

properties.name: Jesus Javier Aleman
properties.circumstances: Officers attempted to make a traffic stop, when the victim's vehicle allegedly sped off and crashed into a pole. The driver was then taken into custody while the victim (the passenger) allegedly fled on foot and fired a gun at officers, who returned fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Gordon Casey
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call of a burglary in progress at the occupied residence of a foreign ambassador. Officers located the victim and allege that he was holding a metal pole One officer discharged a taser. Afterward, another two officers discharged their service pistols.

properties.name: Michael David Johnson
properties.agency_responsible: St. Louis County Sheriff's Office,Virginia State Police
properties.circumstances: Officers were on-site to attempt to apprehend victim for pending warrants. Upon arrival, the victim reportedly came out of his house with knives in his hands. Officers used less lethal weapons first, then lethal rounds, striking and killing the man.

properties.name: Bryant Jackson
properties.circumstances: Officers were conducting a gun trafficking investigation and engaged three men that they were tracking. As officers tried to apprehend them, the victim allegedly pushed an officer and fired a gun at the officer, striking him. An agent returned fire and killed the victim.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to calls about a person walking down the street while holding a gun. When approached, officers allege the man ran, and then stepped into an intersection before turning toward officers with the gun in his hands. Police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Casey Honea
properties.circumstances: The police attempted to stop a car that became a chase. Police used a PIT maneuver to shot his vehicle. Once stopped, the victim exited the car and police allege that he reached for his waist. The police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Ronald Charles Trapp
properties.circumstances: Officers engaged the driver of a car suspected to be stolen. When officers made contact with the driver, they allege that he put the vehicle in reverse and caught the officer in the vehicle door. The officer shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Guy Walker
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a call about concrete on the railroad tracks, the investigation of which led them to the victim's property. They claim that he approached the police with a bow and arrow and they fired shots, which killed him.

properties.name: Larry Marquail Mixon III
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call from a home that indicated that they were being threatened with a gun by an unknown person. Police allege that when they arrived the suspect was firing shots into the home. The police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Barry Yearout
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a complaint about a man on an ATV. They claim they attempted to arrest him, and he charged towards them with a baseball bat. An officer then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Amelia Baca
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call of a woman with dementia and mental disabilities in a home who had a knife.  The responding officer shot and killed the 75 year old woman as she allegedly took a step towards the officer.

properties.name: Nickolas Elisha Pierson
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about a fight at a business. While on site officers allege that they saw victim attacking the store clerk with a knife. Officers shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Oliver Ashley Toledo Saldivar
properties.circumstances: Police received a call for a welfare check for a man slumped in a car alongside the highway.  When police arrived, the victim exited the car and then allegedly began walking toward the officer while reaching into his pocket. The victim allegedly then assaulted the officer and the officer then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Andrea Barrow
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a 911 call about a suspicious vehicle. Police identified the vehicle and when they approached the vehicle they allege that the victim was noncompliant. When they were pulling the victim from the car they allege that the victim grabbed a weapon and started firing. Officers returned fire and the victim was pronounced dead at the scene.

properties.name: Anthony Hood-Schaffner
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a domestic violence call from someone being threatened by someone with a handgun. Officers later located the man and chased him on foot. During pursuit the man allegedly pointed a gun to his own head. He then entered a trailer. During a standoff, the man allegedly shot an officer when another officer returned fire, fatally striking the victim.

properties.name: James Walsh
properties.circumstances: The police allege they initiated a traffic stop of a suspected stolen vehicle and a pursuit ensued. The car later crashed. When the victim exited the vehicle he was allegedly armed. Officers then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Aerie Sadler
properties.circumstances: Deputies went to the victim's place of work to arrest him on multiple warrants. He was known to officers as someone who carried a pistol in his waistband. When they engaged the victim, he allegedly fled on foot and indicated he wanted to be killed. He allegedly pulled out his pistol and turned toward officers, who then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Trevon Bonner
properties.circumstances: The police were at the victim's residence to serve an arrest warrant for a shooting earlier that day. Police say that the victim barricaded himself inside. Police breached the house using an armed vehicle, then deployed gas canisters. They allege that the victim then fired shots from their gun, and police returned fire killing him.

properties.name: Alonzo Nesby
properties.circumstances: Plain clothes officers of the OSHP's Investigative Unit shot at two men outside of a liquor store, killing one of them. No details of the incident leading up to the shooting have been released.

properties.name: Kenneth Brian Turner
properties.circumstances: The police were investigating a suspected stolen motorcycle. When officers arrived they found the victim fitting the description and followed him. Upon engagement, the victim was allegedly holding a gun and pointing it at himself and threatening suicide. After the gun misfired, the victim is alleged to have pointed the gun at officers. They then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Timmy Lee Thurman Jr.
properties.circumstances: The police initiated a traffic stop and allege that the driver then led them on a chase and fired a gun at officers from their vehicle. Once stopped and after running away on foot, the officer alleged the victim pointed a gun at them before they shot and killed him.

properties.name: Paul Derrick Moss II
properties.agency_responsible: Jellico Police Department,Anderson County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a call about an alleged reckless driver. They attempted to stop the victim and allege the victim refused to stop.  Police pursued the victim into Tennessee from Kentucky. The victim's car crashed and then police shot and killed the victim under unreleased circumstances.

properties.name: David Ward Jr.
properties.circumstances: Police were called to a bridge for someone threatening suicide. The victim was allegedly found holding a gun and approached the officers with the weapon. Officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: Jujuan Ballard
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a burglary-in-progress call when they encountered a man who said he'd been shot by someone who was inside a residence. Police then learned that someone else inside the apartment had been shot and may be held hostage. After a standoff, police and the victim exchanged fire multiple time before the victim was shot and killed.

properties.name: Jaime Herrera
properties.circumstances: Police responded to calls about a man acting erratically and possibly under the influence on a roof. Police arrived and allegedly found the victim in possession of knives and a brick that he threw towards officers. Police claim that victim became aggressive and physical with them, which required them to scuffle with him and use their tasers on him multiple times, after which he died.

properties.name: Merrill Rambarose
properties.circumstances: Officers arrived in response to a call about a man threatening someone with an axe. Police encountered the victim, who matched the description of the person from the call. The victim then allegedly went inside and came out holding an axe. The victim was allegedly ordered to drop his weapon, then ran toward officers. As the victim approached the officers, they shot and killed him.

properties.name: Wilford Robert DeWeese
properties.agency_responsible: Manitou Springs Police Department,El Paso County Sheriff's Office,Colorado State Patrol
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about a man threatening an employee of an area business with a gun. The man left, and police later located the person and confirmed him as a suspect. Police engaged in a standoff with the victim before deploying a K9. The man then shot the K9, and then exchanged fire with officers when he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Ali Coulter
properties.circumstances: Police were at victim's mother's residence investigating them as a suspect in a recent murder. They engaged the victim and he allegedly fled on foot with a visible weapon in his hands. After allegedly refusing to drop the weapon he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Dwayne Allen Jackson III
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call of a naked man was shooting an gun outside a residential building. When they arrived the victim was sitting on a curb speaking with a third party. While police were there the victim shot the third party. Police fired their weapons and killed him.

properties.name: Tayler Shannon Osborne
properties.circumstances: Police received a call about two people in a stolen vehicle. Those people moved to another car, which was stopped by police. While police went to arrest the victim for allegedly having visible drugs and guns in their vehicle, the victim allegedly began fighting with police. They allege he punched an officer and stole their Taser. Police allege the victim deployed the Taser when the officers subsequently shot and killed him.

properties.name: David Paul Dixon
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a call about people fighting. They arrived and found a suspect they believed matched the description of one of those involved. That person was allegedly talking incoherently and carrying a makeshift weapon. After not complying with instructions, police tried to arrest the victim when he allegedly swung his weapon at officers. Officers used a taser unsuccessfully. They then shot and killed him.

properties.name: David C. Moran
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a call for assistance with a suicidal man. The police arrived and allege that the victim was holding a handgun. Police claim they attempted de-escalation and that the victim reportedly pointed the firearm at police at which point they fired their weapon and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jonatan Mosqueda
properties.circumstances: The police allege that the victim violated an order of protection and went to an the protected party's house and knocked on door. Waiting officers  tried to engage him, and allege that he fled carrying a gun. They later stopped him and saw him reaching for the ground when officers fired their guns and tasers, killing him.

properties.name: Daniel Valdivia
properties.circumstances: Police responded to calls of a man with a gun and threatening people outside an area business. When police arrived, they encountered the victim and allege that he reached for a gun. Police then shot the victim. The weapon was a bb gun.

properties.name: Christopher Coppola
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to calls that a suspect roaming around area homes with a shotgun and that had fired a loaded shotgun at a neighbor, who then shot at vic and non-fatally injured him. Officers later encountered Coppola and tried to convince him to disarm but Coppola fired at them. Each of three officers fired a shot at Coppola who was struck by two, one of which wounded him fatally

properties.name: Charlie Thompson
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they identified a person sitting in a vehicle as someone with active warrants. They allege that as they asked the suspect to leave his vehicle, he grabbed a visible gun and ran. When he stopped, officers allege they asked him to drop his weapon, he would not comply, and then they shot and killed him.

properties.name: Richard Nichols
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they were responding to a call about a man trespassing on the property who had carried weapon there previously. When officers found the victim inside the business, they allege he stood up and reached for what they believed was a weapon. They then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.agency_responsible: Michigan State Police Department,Taylor Police Department
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a residence following reports of shots fired. They began negotiating with the victim, who allegedly eventually exited the house and fired at officers, who returned fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: James Wesley Morrison
properties.circumstances: Police allege they were looking for a suspect in a domestic disturbance when they located the victim in a vehicle, who matched the description of the suspect. The victim allegedly sped away, and during the following pursuit police disabled his vehicle. A police release indicated that police then exchanged fire during which he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Travis S. Tarrants
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to calls about an armed bank robbery. The police learned from witnesses that the suspect had run into a nearby business and, once confronted, allegedly emerged holding his weapon. The officers opened fire and killed him.

properties.name: Christopher A. Miller
properties.circumstances: The police attempted a traffic stop of a vehicle, which ended up getting away after a short pursuit. When officers later found the vehicle, they allege that the victim exited the car and fired upon them. The police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Josefa Blandon
properties.circumstances: The bystander was walking across the street and the police hit her with their vehicle, killing her.

properties.name: Dustin Levell Saffell
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they identified a vehicle as one belonging to a suspect in other crimes. When they approached the car, they allege that the victim  immediately fired at officers. The officers returned fire and killed him.

properties.name: Gary Lynn McMillan
properties.circumstances: Police were at a residence to serve an active warrant when the victim allegedly resisted, drew a gun and shot at officers, The police returned fire and killed him.

properties.name: Robert L. Wright
properties.agency_responsible: U.S. Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco Firearms and Explosives,US Marshals
properties.circumstances: The police reported that a vehicle pursuit ensued after trying to execute an arrest warrant on the victim. The pursuit ended in a collision, after which officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: Ronald Anthony Smith
properties.circumstances: The police van was speeding, not paying attention, and killed a homeless man.

properties.name: Jeremiah Ruffin
properties.circumstances: Officer was responding to a burglary call. While in transit their vehicle crashes into the victims' vehicle at a high rate of speed. Following the crash, the victims were pronounced dead.

properties.name: Tracey Ashanti Williams
properties.circumstances: Officer was responding to a burglary call. While in transit their vehicle crashes into the victims' vehicle at a high rate of speed. Following the crash, the victims were pronounced dead.

properties.name: Ramiro Guerrero II
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they were trying to make a traffic stop and the driver would not stop. At some point the car slowed and the victim allegedly left the car and ran on foot. During a chase, officers allege that they exchanged gunfire with victim, during which they were shot and killed.

properties.name: Zyhiem Hartman
properties.circumstances: The police responded to hearing gunfire and allegedly found the suspect armed with a weapon near two women with gunshot injuries. They chased the suspect into a residence from which he exchanged fire with officers. After an extended period, they found him dead from an officer's gunshot wound

properties.name: Demarco Mauge
properties.circumstances: Police stopped a vehicle that had been listed as being related to a shooting earlier that week. While talking with the driver, they allege that the victim, a passenger in the vehicle, displayed a handgun. Officers then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Johnny Higgins
properties.circumstances:
A 911 call reported a domestic assault in progress where the victim had allegedly dragging a woman by her hair. Initially, the call came in as “dead air” before dispatch received a second call, and officers responded to the location. The victim allegedly barricaded himself in the house, taking his mother hostage. Officers contained the scene and started negotiations.

Officers used tear gas to draw the victim out of the residence. At that time the victim came to the door with a gun in his hand, officers ordered him to show them his hands. The victim allegedly refuse to comply at which time three shots were fired, the victim was only struck once, and taken to a local hospital his condition is unknown.

properties.name: Jesus Alan Castellanos
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to reports of a man in the area armed with a knife. Man allegedly "charged" at officers wielding knife.  Shortly after arrival 'less lethal' weapons were used, then shots were fired, killing the victim. Details of the encounter not immediately made available.

properties.name: John Withers
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a stolen vehicle that had been taken in an armed carjacking. When police located the vehicle, the victim reportedly fled on foot. Police allege that the victim shot at police and officers exchanged fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Jesse Henri Werling
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a report of shots fired from a man with a known history of mental illness. Officers allege that they exchanged gunfire with the victim at a home. Then, as the victim allegedly fled, the officer's gunfire struck and killed the victim.

properties.name: Robert Otoniel Inosencio
properties.circumstances: Police were executing a warrant for the arrest of the victim. They allege that the victim shot at the officers when when they attempted to arrest the victim. Police shot back and struck the victim. The victim was later found dead, it is unclear if the victim died by the police shooting or died by suicide.

properties.name: Ronnie Dwayne Cesear Jr.
properties.circumstances: Two officers responded to a call about a stabbing. The arrived on-scene to see a car driven through an apartment building lobby and an injured person on the ground. Officers saw the suspect walking away and once they engaged with him, he allegedly turned and walked toward them holding a knife. Officers shot him. The victim fell, dropped the weapon and got back up. Officers deployed their tasers. He later died from his injuries.

properties.name: Ralph Sebexen
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a call about a disturbance outside of a convenience store. After police arrive, they allege an altercation began. Police used a Taser. The altercation allegedly continued and the victim was then shot.

properties.name: Willie Blount
properties.circumstances:
Deputies responded to a breaking and entering in progress, the caller stated her ex-husband had kicked in her door and was armed with a gun.
Deputies arrived and reported that the found the victim standing on the front porch of the house armed with a .22 rifle.The victim ignored numerous verbal commands to drop his weapon and refused to surrender. After an approximately 10-minute standoff, the victim allegedly pointed his rifle at the deputies on scene and was subsequently shot by a deputy. The victim died at the scene.

properties.name: Patrick Lyoya
properties.circumstances: Victim was pulled over by police for reportedly having an "unlicensed vehicle." Police report that the victim ran from the vehicle and reportedly there was a struggle between the victim and the officers. Officer fired weapon and victim was pronounced dead.

properties.name: Christopher C. Hutson
properties.circumstances: Officers were looking for victim to arrest him for a Part 1 crime. Upon locating him, police allege that they saw he was armed with a gun before he fled on foot. The victim was later found behind a home where an encounter took place with a deputy marshal, who fired their weapon, striking and killing him.

properties.name: Ralph Jones
properties.circumstances: Police approached victim as someone they had been told was regularly carrying a gun. Upon engaging with victim, police allege that he pulled out the gun and pointed the gun towards them. They then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Officers attempted to pull the victim over for a vehicle violation. The victim refused to stop, which prompted a chase by police. The victim then allegedly stopped his vehicle, then rammed the officer's car. One officer then shot the victim, wounding him fatally.

properties.name: Ketura Wilson
properties.circumstances: Officers followed the victim after a traffic incident, where a person believed to be the victim exited their vehicle after a collision with a weapon. Officers followed the victim into the store where the victim allegedly exchanged fire with officers. Victim was later pronounced dead at the hospital.

properties.name: Frank Campbell
properties.circumstances: Officers were called to the residents after a report of a woman shot. Upon arrival officers were allegedly opened fire upon. The person of interest then barricaded himself inside. Officers discharged their weapons, striking the man,who was taken to Advocate Christ Medical Center and pronounced dead.

properties.name: Darius Kirkwood
properties.circumstances: The police allege that the victim was a suspect in a shooting earlier in the day. Police located and identified the suspect in his vehicle, and allege that he fled once they attempted a stop. When the vehicle was finally stopped, police were unsuccessful in attempts to get the victim out of the car. Officers then exchanged gunfire with the victim, injuring and killing him.

properties.name: Adam Cobb
properties.circumstances: Responding to a 911 call where gunshots were heard, police arrived at a residence to two females and a dog deceased. Police identified Cobb as a suspect and later found his vehicle driving on a highway before fleeing officers. Police partially disabled his vehicle. When stopped, the police allege he pointed a firearm at police before they fired their weapons killing him.

properties.name: Charles Carswell
properties.agency_responsible: Oklahoma Highway Patrol,Oklahoma City Police Department
properties.circumstances:
After being contacted by police in Sedona, Arizona, about a stolen vehicle driven by a robbery suspect, the Oklahoma Highway Patrol found the vehicle and a pursuit began after troopers attempted a traffic stop. During the pursuit, the suspect allegedly fired shots at troopers through his vehicle’s rear window.  Troopers were able to stop the vehicle and allege after the vehicle was stopped, the suspect got out, grabbed a rifle, and fired at officers as he barricaded himself behind his vehicle. 
Troopers fired back at the suspect, fatally shooting him, according to the highway patrol.

properties.name: Rance Tillman
properties.circumstances: After a brief vehicle chase in Cheyenne following an allegation of assault and robbery, the victim was stopped and exchanged gunfire with officers, during which he was shot and killed.

properties.name: James Allen Miller
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a 911 call placed about a man who was allegedly chasing people with a knife. Officers arrived an encountered the victim, allegedly provided verbal commands. The victim allegedly wouldn't comply to commands and ran toward one of the officers. One officer fired striking the victim. The victim was taken to a local hospital and was pronounced dead.

properties.name: Ralph Ennis
properties.agency_responsible: Warren County Sheriff's Office,Front Royal Police Department
properties.circumstances: Victim was pulled over for speeding. He allegedly resisted arrest and struggled with officers, before two officers allegedly tackled and pushed him to the ground, where he reportedly hit his head. He was taken to the hospital and died 13 days after the incident.

properties.name: James J. Sheets
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they'd initiated a traffic stop but the driver fled. Once they stopped the vehicle and engaged verbally with the driver they allege that they tried to use the stun gun, then shot and killed him after they allege he was holding a gun.

properties.name: Jeremiah Evans
properties.circumstances: The police were executing an eviction, entered the home and allege that the victim approached them with a knife. Officers deployed their tasers and then shot the victim to death.

properties.name: Luis Guerrero Amezcua
properties.circumstances: Officers responded reports of a man breaking windows and assaulting people. Officers immediately restrained the victim upon engagement, using 'force' to do so. The victim died soon after.

properties.name: Jerry Raleigh Livingston
properties.circumstances: Officers attempted a traffic stop of the victim's vehicle and allege that he initially refused to stop, before pulling over. Once stopped, they allege that that he reversed his car into the front of the officer's car, then the deputy fired his gun and killed the victim

properties.name: Jimmy Ray Whiteside
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a domestic dispute where a man was alleged to have injured a woman. When they arrived, they allege the man was holding a machete and a hammer and refused to put down the weapons when the officer shot and killed him.

properties.name: Taylor John Crabb
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a report of suspicious people in an area. Officers arrived to find the victim in the area sitting inside a car. They allege the victim then rammed his vehicle into a police vehicle and fled the area. After a short pursuit, police allege the victims car stopped and he fired multiple shots at officers. More officers were called while the victim sat in his vehicle but not responding. Police then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Jeremy Denna Berg
properties.circumstances: The police have allege a 'shooting incident' involving an officer and victim, but have not released further details.

properties.name: Travis Shaud
properties.circumstances: The police allege that Shaud broke into a family member's house and when the police arrived, started to shoot at the police. He was killed in the shootout.

properties.name: Erik Poul Moller Nielsen
properties.circumstances: Police received a call for assistance after the victim had a seizure. When police arrived they allege the victim became combative. Police allege the victim tried to attack the officer with a stick and allegedly an axe, police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Hector Miguel Portuondo
properties.circumstances: The police claim that they were executing a search warrant on victim and, while in custody, they allege that he got access to a gun and aimed it at officers. They shot and killed him.

properties.name: Michael Stockton
properties.agency_responsible: Columbia County Sheriff's Office,Oregon State Police
properties.circumstances: Police responded to call about a fight at a local business. They arrived and encountered the victim and, while engaging him. is alleged to have drawn a weapon and exchanged fire with officers, where he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Cody Wade Kelley
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call about a suicide concern. Once on the scene officers allegedly found the victim holding a knife to his own throat, taunting officers to shoot him. Police used tasers and eventually were able to get victim to drop the weapon. When officers attempted to remove the victim from the room, they allege that an altercation ensued and the victim allegedly picked up another knife and began using it. The victim was shot and killed.

properties.name: Samantha L. Edgmond
properties.agency_responsible: Pope County Sheriff's Office,"Atkins Police Department, Arkansas State Police"
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they were responding to an attempted residential break-in and allege they identified the woman as the suspect. The victim allegedly approached officers with a metal pipe and ignored the officers' demands for her to drop her weapon. The four officers shot and killed her.

properties.name: Andrew Farnham
properties.circumstances: The police allege that the suspect had threatened to kill his family. When they arrive they allege he was holding a weapon and, as he pointed it at them, they shot and killed him. The weapon was a BB gun.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Officer responded to a call about a mental health crisis. Officer arrived and allegedly encountered the victim holding a knife. When the victim allegedly approached them with a knife, they deployed tasers, and then shot and killed him.

properties.name: Monica Vaught
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about a possible intoxicated driver. The victim was identified as the suspect and, after attempting a traffic stop, allegedly led officers in an extended pursuit. At one point, they allege that she drove at and hit an officer's vehicle when police fired at them. Shots were fired afterward, as well. The victim died of her injuries.

properties.name: Joseph Lee Roy
properties.circumstances: The police allege that he gained access to a police department building and started to attack the police officer with a sharp object. The police officer responded by shooting and killing him.

properties.name: Eric Putnam
properties.circumstances: The police allege that a 911 call came in describing a mental health crisis and the police responded. When they arrived, they claim that he aimed the gun at himself, then the officers. The officers responded by killing him.

properties.name: Joshua Baert
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call of an unknown man having entered a home uninvited, armed with an ax and gun. The man then allegedly fled to the woods. When later encountering the victim, police allege that they exchanged fire with the victim, ultimately striking and killing him.

properties.name: Vance Brown
properties.agency_responsible: Pennsylvania State Police,South Center Township Police
properties.circumstances: Police received a call about a domestic disturbance. Police allege the victim refused to come out of the building and shot at police. Police allege when SWAT arrived, the victim came out of the building with a gun and was subsequently shot and killed.

properties.name: Anthony Nunez
properties.agency_responsible: San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department,Hesperia Police Department
properties.circumstances: Police were called to a residence about a domestic assault. The victim allegedly met officers at the door holding an unspecified weapon. After then allegedly barricading himself inside, he was later said to have exited the home and charging at officers with the weapon. Police then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police were called to a residence for a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, it is alleged that they were told that the victim had been fighting with people and had a firearm. While securing a perimeter, police allege the victim approached the officers and shots were fired. The victim died from a gunshot. It has not been specific who fired shots.

properties.name: Michael Allensworth
properties.circumstances: The police claim that they were responding to a burglary in progress and encountered the victim, allegedly armed with a weapon. They allege that he pointed the gun at them and they shot and killed him. The weapon in question was a starter pistol.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: The police indicate that they were responding to a call about a man with a weapon when they encountered the victim, who allegedly threatedned 'suicide by cop'. Police allege that they were then shot at, and they returned fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Jose Antonio Suarez
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to calls about a man pointing a gun at people. Police encountered the man, who allegedly fired a handgun in their presence before pointing it toward officers. An officer fired their weapon and killed him.

properties.name: David Luis Aguilera
properties.circumstances: The police arrived to a disorderly conduct call at a local business. When officers engaged the man he was allegedly noncompliant. Officers allege that they used tasers to arrest the man, who subsequently tried to drive away in a police vehicle. Multiple officers fired their weapons and killed the man.

properties.name: John McCommas
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a hostage and robbery call when the suspect was later located in a stolen vehicle. Allegedly, after a pursuit the victim's vehicle stopped and the victim and officer exchanged gunfire in which he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Lawrence Knudsen
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to calls from the victim making suicidal threats and indicating he was armed. Officers located and engaged the victim, and allege that that the man was shouting at police and walking toward them with something in his hand. Police shot and killed him in response. It was determined that he was not carrying/holding a weapon.

properties.name: Frederick Clinton Miller
properties.circumstances: The police say that they were responding to a report of someone who was suicidal subject with weapons. They say that when they got to the scene, he was armed and fired on them. The police responded by killing him.

properties.name: Zachary Taylor Anderson
properties.circumstances: Victim was being cared for in the emergency room after a suicide attempt, after being denied care in a mental health facility. Police allege that he left his gurney, acquired a pair of scissors, and raised them and charged at a group of officers, after during which they drew their weapons and shot him.

properties.name: Barney Leroy Peoples Jr
properties.circumstances: Officers claim they were responding to a burglary when they entered the residence and located the victim. When they engaged him, they allege he was armed and pointed a gun at them. They then fired their weapons, which led to the victim's death at the scene.

properties.name: Eli Crawford
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a domestic disturbance. The victim created a hostage situation with his wife and daughter and killed his wife as she tried to exit the home. Victim and police allegedly exchanged fire for hours before police killed him. His daughter was also killed by a shot fired by the police.

properties.name: Clesslynn Jane Crawford
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a domestic disturbance. The victim created a hostage situation with his wife and daughter and killed his wife as she tried to exit the home. Victim and police allegedly exchanged fire for hours before police killed him. His daughter was also killed by a shot fired by the police.

properties.name: To Vung
properties.circumstances: The police claim that they received a call about a man with a gun in a room. As the police approached, they claimed they heard gunfire and fired shots at the victim. Police allege there was both a self-inflicted wound and gunshot from police. Pending investigation.

properties.name: Timothy Yocom
properties.circumstances: Responding to a call about a domestic disturbance, police allege they encountered a woman accusing a man of domestic violence. The man was inside the residence and fired a gun at the officers. After some duration, police allegedly exchanged fire with the victim, ultimately killing him,

properties.name: Robert Gadson
properties.circumstances: Victim was involved in an altercation at a business when off-duty police, working as security at a nearby location, engaged the man outside. They allege that he then pulled out a gun and exchanged fire with officers, during which he was injured. He later died on March 29, 2022.

properties.name: Matthew Cieslak
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about a man with a gun that was carjacking someone near the highway. That person later carjacked a second vehicle. Officers located the vehicle after a search and pursued the vehicle until it crashed. Victim and police then exchanged gunfire, during which the victim was shot and killed.

properties.name: Bryan Otto
properties.circumstances: The police claim that they were responding to a complaint involving the victim when he drove up and allegedly pulled out a weapon. The police killed him in response.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: An off-duty deputy was riding in a car with his mother after she was involved in a domestic event with her husband/his father when the aggressor crashed into their car and approached them with a gun. After the father shot the deputy the officer pulled his weapon and killed the man.

properties.name: Zachary Taylor Anderson
properties.circumstances: Victim was a patient at the Cleveland Clinic ER for attempted suicide. Victim left his gurney, grabbed scissors and ran through the hallway. Victim approached officers, with scissors in-hand and arm raised, as two officers shot him while retreating.

properties.name: Miguel Estrella
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a first call from victim's friends telling them he was in crisis and has "a history of mental illness and was cutting himself". They evaluated him and determined he did not qualify to be committed, so they left. A subsequent call was made and when officers arrived and engaged with him he was allegedly holding a knife. The police say that he advanced on them with a knife, they deployed tasers and then fired their guns, killing him.

properties.name: Zy’Shonne Johnson
properties.circumstances: The police claim they were engaged in an undercover narcotics sting when the victim recognized police and fled in his car. Officers pursued, and the driver crashed into multiple vehicles before exiting the car to flee on foot. While in pursuit, police claim he turned toward officers while holding a handgun and then they killed him. At least one witness indicates victim had his hands above his head, complying with officers' instructions when he was shot.

properties.name: Charles Henry Calhoun
