properties.circumstances: The police claim they were responding to reports of a man staggering through the neighborhood with a gun, and of shots fired. The police encountered the victim and claim that he pointed the weapon at the officers. The police then killed him.

properties.name: Felix Catarino
properties.circumstances: The police were called to the scene where a taxi driver said that the passenger refused to pay his fare. The police claim they tried to take the man into custody, but he picked up a metal pipe and then killed him.

properties.name: Ayden Kyle
properties.agency_responsible: Mohave County Sheriff's Office,Bullhead City Police Department
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a location alleging a domestic violence incident. Officers approached the victim, allege that he was visibly armed and fled on foot. A gunshot may have been heard from the direction of the suspect. When they engaged him, the victim allegedly refused to comply and pointed a weapon in the officers' direction. Officers shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Alberto Noriega
properties.circumstances: Officers allege they recognized a moving motorcycle as being a stolen vehicle and began following the driver. The driver allegedly fled from officers and they used a non-lethal weapon to knock over the driver. When officers approached, they allege they saw that the victim was carrying a weapon. Police first used tasers, and then multiple officers shot and killed victim.

properties.name: Robert Steven Jones
properties.agency_responsible: Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office,Oakley Police Department
properties.circumstances: The police claim they were responding to a domestic dispute when the man approached the police with a knife then dropped the knife. The police allege that he then returned with a Umarex AirJavelin Archery Rifle after which the police killed him.

properties.name: Michael D. Olson
properties.circumstances: Police allege that victim escaped from a local jail. Once located, while police were attempting an arrest, the victim allegedly attempted to take control of an officer's weapon when police shot and killed him.

properties.name: Jessica Amber Schoverling
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they were attempting to serve a felony arrest warrant, encountered the victim inside her residence where they say she pointed a rifle at an officer to which officers responded by shooting and killing her.

properties.name: Daren Lee Henle
properties.circumstances: The police responded to a call about a man shooting a handgun in the middle of the street. Upon arrival they allege they encountered victim with a handgun and refusing to drop it. Police used a taser then, when he allegedly pointed the weapon at police, shot and killed him.

properties.name: Nicholas Conklin
properties.circumstances: Police report that officers were responding to a call about a stolen car, which they then linked to the victim and a number of related, outstanding arrest warrants. Upon following up at a nearby residence, police allege they saw the victim try and leave out a window before firing shots at officers while advancing toward them. Police fired their weapons in response, striking and killing the victim.

properties.name: Collin Neztsosie
properties.circumstances: Apparently, residents called 911 saying that a man was carrying around a gun. The alleged gunman also called 911. When the police arrived, they killed the alleged gunman.

properties.name: Rodney K. Robinson II
properties.circumstances: There were reports that Robinson had a gun leaving a restaurant. They searched for him but could not find him. He allegedly returned to the restaurant. The police arrived and chased him. The police shot him while he was fleeing and he died.

properties.name: Travis Don Sipes
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they were executing a wanted person search due to active warrants and a fraud investigation and they allege that the man pulled a gun on the police leading to them shooting him to death.

properties.name: Richard Schaare
properties.circumstances: The police allege that there was a domestic disturbance and when they arrived they saw a man with a gun who refused to drop the gun. The police then allege that he pointed the gun at officers, leading to 3 officers shooting him to death.

properties.name: Irvin D. Moorer Charley
properties.circumstances: The police said that they were responding to a domestic violence and encountered the victim outside, allegedly holding a wooden stick.  The police allege that he approached officers and they used a taser. After this, he is said to have charged toward another officer when they shot and killed him.

properties.name: Ryan Waldner
properties.circumstances: The police were called about a shooting and went to victim's residence and identified him as the shooter. Multiple gunshots were heard both inside house and shots were fired toward officers. An officer shot and killed the victim in an exchange of fire.

properties.name: Blaine Clutter
properties.agency_responsible: Casper Police Department,Natrona County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Officers went to a residence to serve a narcotics-related arrest warrant when victim ran inside the house and other residents ran outside. Shots were fired at officers before both exchanged fire. Victim was shot and killed during the exchange.

properties.name: Riley W. Stephens
properties.circumstances: The police were responding to a call about a man with a knife and allege found and engaged a man that holding knife and cutting themselves. They allege the victim did not respond to verbal commands and when he began approaching officers they shot and killed him.

properties.name: Faubricia Virtaux Gainer
properties.circumstances: The police allege that Ms. Gainer stabbed two people and then lunged at the police with a knife, leading them to shoot her to death.

properties.name: Billy Mitchell
properties.circumstances: The police claim that they confronted Mr. Mitchell walking in the middle of the road and when approached, he allegedly lunged at the police with the knife. In turn, the police officer shot and killed Mr. Mitchell.

properties.name: James J. Emery
properties.circumstances: Two officers from the Bonne Terre Police Department were dispatched to the Motel 6 in Bonne Terre for a reported disturbance. When the officers arrived, a man exited the motel room and allegedly began exchanging shots with them. Victim was killed during the exchange.

properties.name: James B. Watts
properties.circumstances: The police allege that they were attempting to serve an arrest warrant when Mr. Watts exited the car with a gun, leading to the police killing him. He was attempting to enter the bank when the police killed him.

properties.name: Michael Mercado
properties.circumstances: Police were flagged down by a driver reporting an erratic driver. The victim then pulled up and jumped out while the car was still moving. In subsequent exchange with police, man allegedly provoked and moved toward police and gestured like he was pointing a gun. Police fired their weapons and killed the victim.

properties.name: Mauricio Martinez Yanez
properties.circumstances: The police allege they had identified victim as a suspect in an armed robbery. They were chasing him on foot when the victim allegedly hid behind a shed and exchanged shots with police, when he was killed by gunfire.

properties.name: Malcolm Staton
properties.circumstances: The police attempted to initiate a traffic stop on a car in a parking lot using three unmarked police cars to surround the vehicle. When this happened, they allege that the driver knowingly attempted to drive away. During this, the victim's car and at least two of the police vehicles collided, after which officers shot and killed the victim. Three children and a female passenger were also in the vehicle.

properties.name: Jeremy Dayton
properties.circumstances: Members of a SWAT team tried to arrest Dayton during an investigation of felony assault with a firearm. The man allegedly fired at deputies and deputies fired back.

properties.name: Jason Peterson
properties.circumstances: Police were dispatched after a call about a domestic disturbance. Matching the description, officers encountered victim allegedly armed with a rifle. Police ultimately shot and killed him.

properties.name: Carlos Salas
properties.circumstances: Police were called for a welfare check and possible shots fired. Upon contact with the victim, he allegedly stated he wanted to police to kill him. During the resulting standoff, the victim allegedly exchanged fire with police from inside the house. Police breached the house with an armored truck and deployed tear gas. Police state the victim then climbed out of a window and exchanged fire with them outside when he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Kevin Donel Johnson, Jr.
properties.circumstances: Officers on patrol recognized the victim as someone wanted on one or more felonies. After seeing officers, the man allegedly fled on foot. Three officers opened fire when the victim allegedly pulled a gun from his waistband.

properties.name: Jose DeJesus Hernandez
properties.circumstances: A man requesting an ambulance in the rear of the parking lot, police said. The officers found the man in a vehicle in the back of the parking lot, and when police approached him, he brandished a weapon. Officers took up a place of safety and tried to get the man to put the weapon down, police said. After a short standoff, the man fired his weapon, and one Shorewood officer returned fire, hitting the man, according to police.

properties.name: John Dawson Hunter
properties.circumstances: Officers responding to an active shooter call encountered victim on his porch when he allegedly moved quickly toward a visible weapon. Three officers fired their weapons, killing him.

properties.name: Janet Jordan
properties.circumstances: The victim was found dead. The alleged killer was named as a Rochester Police sergeant, who was later also found dead, allegedly of self inflicted wounds.

properties.name: Toney S. Poulston Jr.
properties.agency_responsible: Covington Police Department,Alleghany County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Poulston got into a “domestic situation” with a relative working at the store — identified as 64-year-old Randall Lee Paxton of Covington — and reportedly ended up shooting Paxton. When Covington and Alleghany County authorities responded to the incident at the gas station, they saw an allegedly armed Poulston leaving the store. Shots were exchanged, leading to the death of Poulston and a Covington Police Officer, Caleb Daniel Ogilvie.

properties.name: Matthew J. Parks
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a domestic abuse call. Police arrived and found the victim in a hallway holding a knife. Police shot and killed him.

properties.name: Samuel Nunez
properties.circumstances: Deputies were in the area following up on a domestic disturbance call from earlier in the evening.  They attempted to make contact with the subject who was sitting in his vehicle when he allegedly crashed into two patrol vehicles.  He was shot by the deputies; it was revealed that he was not involved in the domestic disturbance call from earlier in the evening.

properties.name: Gabriel T. Artz
properties.circumstances: Officers responding to a report of a fight with one person with a knife and another person bleeding. They encountered the victim, allegedly still holding a knife and acting aggressively toward officers. The victim did not respond to alleged de-escalation steps by police, and upon the victim allegedly rearing the arm with the knife back as if to throw it at officers, was fired upon.

properties.name: Nicholas Edward Oden
properties.circumstances: Decatur Police responded to a home invasion call. Officers reportedly found the homeowner who had been shot in the leg. The suspect then fled the scene in a white Jeep. Police chased the driver and disabled the car. The suspect allegedly fired a gun at the officers, and they returned fire, striking the suspect several times. The suspect was taken to the hospital where he died.

properties.name: Fred Westmoreland
properties.agency_responsible: California Highway Patrol ,Tuolumne County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Deputies later responded to an emergency response request from Cal Fire from Westmoreland crashing his car. Westmoreland was reportedly trying to leave the crash scene while intoxicated and while in possession of a revolver. Deputies chased him to Sonora. Westmoreland stopped his car in the driveway of a nearby home, got out of the car and confronted the deputy with a revolver. A CHP officer arrived to help the deputy with the situation. Law enforcement fired at Westmoreland when he pointed a loaded gun at the deputy and officer, authorities said. Westmoreland died at the scene.

properties.name: Anthony Rayfield
properties.circumstances:
No indication officers fired shots

Officers responded to victim's home in response to call about a subject threatening to cause damage to his home, neighbors, law enforcement and himself. Suspect allegedly barricaded himself inside his home and fired shots at officers. The home later burned with victim inside. No cause of death given. No cause of fire given. No indication yet the extent that officers interacted or responded to victim. It’s unclear who called police. Neither Horry County police nor the South Carolina Law Enforcement Division has released information on the call. 

Victim a.k.a. Tony “Porkchop” Rayfield

properties.name: Zakareya Ibrahim
properties.circumstances: Someone made a threatening 911 call saying they wanted to "stab everyone". Officer Toral arrived and the victim approached his vehicle and allegedly stabbed Toral multiple times with scissors. Officer Dunn then arrived and shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Adam Vespoli
properties.circumstances: The police were called to remove two men from the bus. When they got off the bus, one of the men allegedly got into the driver's side of the police car and the police officer shot him and killed him to stop him from taking the car.

properties.name: William Taylor Parrott
properties.circumstances: Officers were dispatched to a convenience store after reports of someone crashing into cars in the parking lot. They encountered the victim who was allegedly armed with a hammer. Police allege that victim lunged toward an officer, who shot and killed him.

properties.name: Paul Anthony Hardiman
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to call of caretaker abuse. When they arrived, the victim (caretaker) came out of the house and pulled out a rifle, at which point deputies shot and killed him.

properties.name: Thomas Lester Ketelsen
properties.circumstances: Recognizing a vehicle to be that of a wanted armed robbery suspect, a deputy used a PIT maneuver to stop the vehicle while traveling on a highway. The maneuver caused the vehicle to crash and killed the driver

properties.name: Alonzo Carter
properties.circumstances: While off-duty working security at a nearby fuel two the officer allegedly encountered the suspect exchanging gunfire with another person. When the victim allegedly would not comply with verbal commands, the officer shot and killed him.

properties.name: Quentrice McAllister
properties.circumstances: The police allege that victim arrived at a detention center and fired aa firearm when three officers responded with gunfire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Tyrea Pryor
properties.circumstances: Responding to a call of people in a white vehicle banging on the door of a residence, officers allege a white sedan matching description was speeding away. During subsequent pursuit the vehicle collided with another, stopping. As officers approached, they allege seeing a weapon near the driver when two deputies fired their weapons, killing the man.

properties.name: David Enriquez Hernandez
properties.circumstances: The victim allegedly ran a red light where officers were gathered for a seatbelt enforcement detail, then collided with several cars and a utility pole before exiting his car holding two knives. Victim allegedly would not comply with verbal orders before an officer shot and killed him.

properties.name: Felix Tyler
properties.circumstances: Officers were called to a business about a woman being held hostage by an armed domestic partner. Police from multiple agencies engaged in a standoff with victim and hostage for hours. Police exchanged gunfire, then later disabled and shot the victim.

properties.name: Darin E. Klep
properties.agency_responsible: Siskiyou County Sheriff's Department,Mount Shasta Police Department
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a domestic violence call when they encountered victim holding a firearm to his head. During negotiations victim then pointed weapon at officers who responded with their weapons, killing the man.

properties.name: Gabriel Scott Rau
properties.circumstances: Responding to a burglary in progress, officers encountered the victim in the garage of a residence, allegedly armed with two knives. Police say he charged at officers just before they fired their weapons killing the man.

properties.name: Robert Charles Raymond
properties.circumstances: Three officers were at a residence searching for victim to serve a warrant when, during a search of the property, encountered the victim in the outbuilding and he allegedly fired upon them with a gun. Officers responded with their weapons, killing the man,

properties.name: William Weldon
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a domestic disturbance call when they were fired upon from inside a home. Tactical teams were called and suspect was forced from the home, when he allegedly fired at officers, who fired their weapons in response and killed the man.

properties.name: Anthony R. Felix
properties.circumstances: Officers who were responding to a disturbance with an armed man call engaged and attempted to arrest victim. Gunfire was exchanged and then the victim allegedly fled the initial location in a police vehicle. After a pursuit resulting in a collision, victim left vehicle and exchanged shots with officers again, resulting in his death.

properties.name: Antwon Leonard Cooper
properties.circumstances: During a traffic stop, police had asked the driver to exit the vehicle and were conducting a pat-down when a physical struggle ensued. During the struggle, another officer fired a single shot resulting in the death of the victim.

properties.name: James Gregory
properties.circumstances: Around 9:30 a.m., officers made an attempt to locate a man for an investigation on charges from Mississippi. Officers made contact with a man who matched the description of the suspect. The man and the officers reportedly exchanged fire in the 200 block of N. Circle Dr. The man then fled. Officers made contact with him again in the 400 block of N. Circle Dr. The man allegedly drew a firearm. At least one officer then fired a handgun at least once time, killing the suspect.

properties.name: Joshua Dismuke
properties.circumstances: An officer with a municipal department attempted a traffic stop and the driver would not stop. County sheriff's took up the pursuit and the car was ultimately disabled. With the car stopped, police approached the vehicle and allegedly heard a single gunshot. Police fired their weapons at the driver in response.

properties.name: Miguel Ruiz Rivera
properties.circumstances: After hearing a shooting, officers were on foot investigating and asking for witnesses when they observed a subject who appeared to be firing a weapon into a tent. After engaging, the victim allegedly turned in the direction of the officers while pointing a gun and fired multiple shots in their direction. Two officers exchanged gunfire with victim, which resulted in his fatal injuries.

properties.name: Albert Beckworth-Thompson
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a residential area to calls of a man behaving erratically and believed to have broken into a home. The victim was confused and unable to comply with officers. There was a struggle when officers tried to place victim in custody and tasers were deployed. After securing victim he began to lose consciousness and ultimately died.

properties.name: Lester Carlton Epps
properties.circumstances: Police were called to a residence for an armed individual. The individual sat on the porch and waited for police. When they arrived he allegedly pointed his gun at officers, when they shot and killed him

properties.name: Jerry Lott
properties.circumstances: Officers arrived at the site of a domestic violence call and victim drove off at a high rate of speed. Identified as the aggressor in the domestic incident, police later identified the victim's vehicle and observed them as possibly being impaired. When the vehicle stopped the victim allegedly exited the vehicle yelling at police, and reached back in the vehicle, and when turning back towards officers he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Multiple officers shot a man when he allegedly rammed his car into the Federal building and fired a rifle downtown.

properties.name: Feliciano Lionel Jimenez
properties.circumstances: Police were traveling to a reported fight when they struck and killed victim with their vehicle while he was walking

properties.name: Michael Ramos Jr.
properties.agency_responsible: California Highway Patrol ,California City Police Department,Kern County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Responding to a report of a man shooting BBs at trailers and vehicle windows, officers encountered a man allegedly armed with a bow and arrow. He barricaded himself inside a trailer and refused to come out. After lengthy negotiations, the victim came outside onto the porch, allegedly visibly armed with several weapons, after which officers fired their weapons, killing the victim.

properties.name: Samuel Yeatts Wilson
properties.circumstances: Police were called by a landlord who wanted a person off their property. Upon arrival, the victim allegedly approached officers armed with a gun. The officers shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jon Jones Sr.
properties.circumstances: Off deputy deputy was excessively speeding in his marked sheriff's vehicle when he crashes into victim's car, killing him. His wife was a passenger and severely injured

properties.name: Kevin P. Zimmerman
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call from the victim that they were under attack in their home. When police arrived the doors were locked and dispatch informed the officers that someone else inside the building had reported that the victim was armed with two knives. Police then entered, the victim allegedly moved toward and attacked the officers with the knife, and the victim was shot and killed.

properties.name: Juan Herrera
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a burglary call to an apartment complex when the victim was shot. No other details at this time.

properties.name: Edgar Ortiz
properties.circumstances: While in the area addressing an unrelated crash, deputies were approached by a person stating he had been injured by someone with a garden tool. He pointed out the victim and when deputies went to detain him he allegedly ran away. When they caught up, he then allegedly approached them while swinging the tool, and they opened fire.

properties.name: Osman Brown
properties.circumstances: Police from multiple agencies engaged in a lengthy standoff after being called to a residence about a threatening person with a gun. Victim would not come out until hours later, when he came out on porch and allegedly pointed a gun at officers, when officers opened fire and killed him.

properties.name: Jamarian Marquis McGhee
properties.circumstances: A stolen car was spotted by officers. Deputies closed in on the parked vehicle and victim allegedly backed the car up toward officers when an officer fired the shot that killed him.

properties.name: Alfred Calvin Moss III
properties.circumstances: Police were led on a brief vehicle chase in which victim was a passenger. The car was disabled by officers and they were told by victim he had an explosive device on board that they were threatening to use against officers and the driver of the car. After an hours-long standoff, police shot victim.

properties.name: Yan Li
properties.circumstances: Police at victim's apartment to serve an eviction notice encountered her allegedly holding a knife and slammed the door on them. More police were called and police entered her apartment and cornered her in her bedroom. She then allegedly ran out of her bedroom holding the knife and wounded an officer, after which officers opened fire.

properties.name: Alberto Riascos
properties.circumstances: Police were looking for victim to detain them as part of a homicide investigation when they encountered him walking on the street. Officers running to catch up with victim allege they were fired upon and one officer exchanged fire, killing him

properties.name: Crasteven Kennon Wilson
properties.circumstances: Responding to a disturbance call, officers approached victim and asked to perform a pat-search. When officers put a hand on Wilson, they allege that he pulled a gun and shot at the officer, striking him in the right thigh. The officer returned fire, after which the victim fled on foot. Wilson was found a short time later and taken to the hospital where he later died of his wounds.

properties.name: Frank Lovato
properties.circumstances: Patrol cars collided with a stolen vehicle and uninvolved motorist Frank Lovato, a former firefighter, who died as a result of the crash.

properties.name: Luke David Stash
properties.circumstances: Police responding to a welfare check call on a woman were let into a residence by Stash, where the woman was found deceased. When police attempted to detain Stash, he allegedly pulled out a firearm and exchanged shots with officers, where he was killed

properties.name: Darian Quinlan Bryant
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a robbery call at a business when they located the victim, running from the area. After a chase, they located them in an apartment and had him exit, when he fled on foot again. Police caught him and allege he fired a shot from a weapon, when multiple officers returned fire, killing him

properties.name: Thomas Siderio Jr.
properties.circumstances: Plain clothes officers approached 12 yo victim and another 17 yo boy for questioning on a previous case, they had emergency lights going in vehicle. A shot was heard and a vehicle window shattered, after which officers exited their vehicle. Officers believe the victim fired the shot. An officer then chased victim and then shot him in the back. A weapon was located near the incident but at a significant distance from the victim. That officer is suspended with the intent to be fired pending completion of investigation.

properties.name: Kourtney Sherwood
properties.circumstances: The police allege that she was stopped on the side of the road and was asked to put her hands up. Reports allege that she was threatening to harm herself or others. They allege that she then picks up a gun and fires it at the police to which they respond by killing her.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Reponding to mutliple calls of a person armed person in a business, Lyon County,, Yerington Police, and Nevada State Police responded and one officer shot and killed victim. No details about the circumstances or the involvement of the victim to the initial reports have been released

properties.name: John Charles Moreida
properties.circumstances: Police engaged victim at his residence while following up on a warrarnt. Victim allegedly approached officer with an 'edged weapon', when officer fired his weapon killing him

properties.name: Marcelo Alfredo Suarez
properties.circumstances: Identifying vehicle as one that was carjacked at gunpoint earlier, police engaged the driver, who allegedly exited the car running. Victim allegedly fired a weapon at officers when they shot the victim.

properties.name: Derek Stortzum
properties.circumstances: After attempting a traffic stop for erratic driving, victim allegedly fled from police, who used a PIT maneuver with their vehicle, causing victim to crash and was killed

properties.name: Jacob Huerta
properties.circumstances: Officers initiated a traffic stop after identifying victims car as possibly being involved in a hit-and-run earlier in the day. Allegedly, after initially refusing to exit the vehicle, victim then exited and ran at officers with a knife when they fired their weapons, killing him.

properties.name: David Cottes Jr
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a call about a man yelling that he was being robbed and yelling for neighbors to call 911. Officers arrived and shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Gregory Lasselle
properties.circumstances: Police were called to residence by his parents who were worried about his 'state of mind.' Police engaged victim from some distance and attempted for over 12 hours to get victim to exit. No other details have been released.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police were attempting a traffic stop of someone suspected of domestic abuse and home invasion when victim sped away, leading officers on a high-speed chase. After crashing his vehicle, police shot and killed victim

properties.name: Raphael Marquez
properties.circumstances: Police were involved in a vehicle chase with victim after reports of kidnappings, stolen vehicles and shots fired. Police disabled vehicle using spike strips and PIT maneuver when police allege victim emerged from vehicle and pointed something at officers when they opened fire

properties.name: Brian Dangerfield
properties.circumstances: Victims were in a vehicle that was crossing an intersection when an officer driving at 100 mph in a 55 mph zone crashed into victims, resulting in injuries leading to their deaths.

properties.name: Mary Dangerfield
properties.circumstances: Victims were in a vehicle that was crossing an intersection when an officer driving at 100 mph in a 55 mph zone crashed into victims, resulting in injuries leading to their deaths.

properties.name: Steven Wohlwend
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a hotel where a armed robbery was reported. Police later engaged the victim and shot him after he would not comply with orders to show his hands. Reports have not confirmed the victim as the person responsible for robbery

properties.name: Andrew Castellano
properties.circumstances: Police responding to a call about a car stuck in the snow allege that during questioning of the driver he pulled a weapon and pointed it at officers. Police initially alleged that the victim had fired at officers.

properties.name: Jacori Shaw
properties.circumstances: Officers from Sparks Police, Reno Police and Washoe County Sheriff's Office encountered victim while trying to serve a warrant when victim allegedly ran. K9 was used and victim allegedly brandished a gun when officers opened fire. A gun was later found some distance from victim

properties.name: Daniel Ramirez
properties.circumstances: An officer spotted a vehicle that appeared to be stranded. Officer spoke with driver, who then allegedly fled on foot. During chase, victim and officer exchanged gunfire where victim was killed

properties.name: Steven Lewis Finfrock
properties.agency_responsible: Georgia State Patrol,Monroe County Sheriff's Office
properties.circumstances: Victim's vehicle had broken down on the side of the highway. Transportation assist arrived but could not get a response from driver. Police were called with 7 officers from Georgia State Patrol and Monroe County sheriff’s office responding. After hearing shots fired within vehicle, police allege victim then exited vehicle and pointed weapon at police, when they opened fire and killed victim.

properties.name: Keleen RaShad Connell
properties.circumstances: Police allege they spotted victim and, recognizing him as a suspect in another crime, began a foot chase where they shot victim

properties.name: Joey Gilbert Gauthreaux
properties.circumstances: No details of officer shooting given as of 4/20/22 JW

properties.name: Keishon Thomas
properties.circumstances:
Victim died in police custody. 
Victim was arrested by Milwaukee police for a warrant and suspected illegal narcotics on him during a traffic stop. He was taken to Milwaukee's District 5 police station, where he spent about 16 hours in custody. Officers allegedly then noticed that while Thomas was in a cell that he needed medical attention but died as police and fire department tried to help him. The Milwaukee County medical examiner's office performed an autopsy and found no evidence of trauma. The cause of death is pending on a toxicology report. Three officers have been suspended as a result of Thomas' death.

properties.name: Czyz Harrison
properties.circumstances: An off-dudy HPD officer working as mall security engaged victim after his credit card was declined in a store. There was an altercation where the victim allegedly pulled the officer's handgun and shot him. After police responded they identified the victim in the mall carrying an ice pick, and after refusing to put it down was shot by two officers.

properties.name: Richard Ward
properties.circumstances: Police, responding to a call of man attempting to get into wrong car, engaged victim, and allege that during an altercation he tried to disarm an officer, who then shot him.

properties.name: Matthew Allen Deese
properties.circumstances: Police responding to a call about a suicidal man resulted in victim barricading himself in a residence with a gun. Police Special Response shot the man after 'failed negotiations'

properties.name: Robert Lee Pilkey
properties.circumstances: Police were investigating a call about a suspicious person when they encountered victim, who was allegedly armed with a knife. Details of the encounter have not been released, but deputies shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Lawrence LeJames Rodgers
properties.circumstances: Police were following up on a dropped 911 call. When arriving on location with 8 officers, they handcuff and question two men who were leaving the residence. They verbally contact the victim, still in the house, who then called 911 and explained he had a gun and was inside with one other man. In contact with police, he came to the exit with his hands and weapon visible and police fired their weapons and hit victim. Records indicate victim then went back inside and shot the other occupant, then died of his injuries.

properties.name: Tracy Gaeta
properties.circumstances: Police allege that victim collided with an officers vehicle and fled. After later finding the vehicle, victim allegedly backed her car into another officer, who opened fire, emptying two clips of bullets which killed her

properties.name: David Liles
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about someone having a mental health crisis when they encountered victim allegedly holding two knives. Victim allegedly lunged at an officer when he fired his weapon, killing him

properties.name: Brandon Cruz
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call of a suicidal individual when they encountered victim driving in his vehicle and attempted a traffic stop. After a chase, police later encountered victim and allege that he revved his car engine and began to drive his car toward officers. They opened fire and killed the victim

properties.name: Louisson Pierrot
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a domestic disturbance call with a full tactical team 3 hours later and, upon entering residence, claim the victim was actively choking his wife when an officered open fire, killing the victim.

properties.name: Christopher Tkal
properties.circumstances: Trooper, responding to a 911 domestic violence call, shot Christopher Tkal, 57, more than once inside Tkal’s home on County Road. He died at the scene, and no one else was hurt in the shooting incident. Authorities allege that there was a loaded rifle underneath Tkal’s body following the shooting. There’s no indication yet if that rifle had been fired or if Tkal had been holding it. However, none of the troopers responding to the 911 call from Tkal’s house had body cameras or dashboard cameras.

properties.name: Alexandro Rosales
properties.circumstances: Responding to domestic violence call, officers allegedly encountered victim who immediately pulled a weapon and exchanged shots with two police officers, where he was killed.

properties.name: Mizael Corrales
properties.circumstances: Plainclothes police called in uniformed officers for what was described as an identified stolen vehicle. Uniformed officers approached the vehicle on foot, with plainclothes officers on-site, when victim allegedly tried to drive away, crashing into parked vehicles. Two officers were knocked down, one of whom stood back up and fired multiple shots at the victim through both the windshield and open driversside window

properties.name: Joel Michael Arevalo
properties.circumstances:
Police responding to a disturbance call, and who subsequently had been told that shots had been fired at that site. Upon arrival they encountered victim and fired shots when he was allegedly noncompliant and had hands in pockets. 

Police in subsequent questioning would not answer questions about whether victim was armed at the time of shooting, or was the person who fired reported shots.

properties.name: Daniel Patrick Knight
properties.circumstances: Responding to a call about a dangerous man, police arrived at a wedding to investigate. After engaging the victim, police allege he assaulted an officer and in response they deployed taser and then fired a weapon. Family disputes assault claim. Victim later died at the hospital.

properties.name: Donnell Rochester
properties.circumstances: Police followed a vehicle believed to contain the subject of a warrant. After the driver got out of the vehicle, officers approached and the driver allegedly got back into the vehicle. They allege that the car moved toward an officer when police opened fire, injuring and killing him.

properties.name: Carmelo Cruz-Marcos
properties.circumstances: Border patrol agents responded to reports of undocumented immigrants. The victim allegedly attempted to flee. One agent pursued the victim, and they engaged in an altercation in which the victim allegedly resisted arrest, struck the officer and then picked up a rock. The Agent then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Murdock J. Phillips
properties.circumstances: Pierce County Sheriff’s Department went to residence to arrest victim when he reportedly appeared to reach for a weapon and one of the officers discharged their firearm. Victim fled by foot and was later found by Centralia officers who shot and killed victim after he used a sharp weapon to injure an officer

properties.name: Michael Freigang
properties.circumstances: Victim's vehicle allegedly moved through a marked crime scene when police fired their weapons, killing the driver

properties.name: Cody Brandon Chavez
properties.circumstances: Responding to a called domestic abuse, officers engaged the victim who then allegedly held police in an hours long standoff. Victim then exited residence while allegedly holding a knife, and lunged at officers who fired their weapons in response

properties.name: John Michael Humphries
properties.circumstances: According to police, officers were responding to reports of a gunman at a when they encountered victim. Victim allegedly fled from officers, then returned to business and fired a shot inside. Victim then allegedly fired a shot at a responding officer, who returned fire, killing Humphries.

properties.name: Ringo Van Winkle
properties.circumstances:
Mesa Police were dispatched to an intersection where a department surveillance camera monitoring program identified a suspect shooting a gun outdoors. Police arrived and approached the alleged suspect and deployed tasers, beanbag rounds and gunshots, killing the victim. 

No indication that a weapon was present at the time of the officers' shooting

properties.name: Zachary Tyler Alvarenga
properties.agency_responsible: West Jordan Police Department,South Jordan Police Department,Unified Police Department of Greater Salt Lake
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call of domestic abuse and kidnapping when they encountered the suspect who fled in a vehicle. After an extended series of vehicle chases where allegedly police and victim exchanged shots, police disabled victim's vehicle and fired their weapons as he fled on foot

properties.name: Oscar Alcantara
properties.circumstances: Police were investigating a disorderly conduct call from earlier in the week when they observed the suspect entered a vehicle with another driver. Police later stopped the vehicle and the driver ran from the vehicle and allegedly told officers the suspect had a gun and was in the vehicle with her infant son. The man then drove away “at a high rate of speed,” and led officers on an extended chase. The suspect ultimately stopped the vehicle and allegedly ran into an open field with the infant, according to police. Officers contacted the man by cellphone and he allegedly threatened to kill the infant and was seen “pointing a gun at the child,” after which an officer shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Mathew Cook
properties.circumstances: While investigating a stolen vehicle, officers allegedly saw two suspects one of whom ran when they saw officers. After a brief chase there was an altercation and victim allegedly pulled a weapon, in which officers fired their guns in response

properties.name: Roger Wayne Ellis
properties.agency_responsible: Camp Hill Police,North Middleton Township Police
properties.circumstances: Officers were there to arrest victim on a warrant resulting from a car chase in Camp Hill, when victim shot an officer. Police retreated and shot victim when he was attempting to escape residence via a window

properties.name: Alberto Rodriguez Jr
properties.circumstances: A multi-agency task force were on-site to execute a warrant for bond forfeiture related to a homicide charge when they encountered victim, who allegedly brandished and reached for a weapon when officers from both agencies fired their weapons.

properties.name: David A. Babcock
properties.circumstances: The police claim they were trying to effectuate a traffic stop for a possible stolen vehicle but the vehicle fled. Then they shot the driver in the head.

properties.name: Daniel Vallee
properties.circumstances: While responding to a noise complaint, officers encountered victim in his vehicle and asked him to exit. Vallee refused their commands for a number of minutes, eventually turning on his engine, then honking the horn. When the horn was sounded, deputies opened fire and victim died at the scene.

properties.name: Atiba Lewis
properties.circumstances: The police claim that they were executing an order to evict Lewis and many agencies joined. Later that morning they executed a search warrant for a gun. They claim that later they attempted to arrest Lewis for unlawful firearm possession and he approached them aggressively with a knife and an officer fired his gun in response.

properties.name: Jacob Salas-Tijerina
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a mental health call of someone that was suicidal. Looking for this person, he was found inside a business and police allege that he came out of a back room and pointed a gun at them and mental health counselors on site. One officer fired shots and killed victim. The officer's bullets also injured an unrelated party inside.

properties.name: Raymond D. Dupree
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a report of a man walking outside carrying what appeared to be a handgun. When arriving onsite, officers allege observing the victim point the gun at a vehicle, and then at a group of people outside. Officer approached victim when he allege he pointed the gun at police, when he fired multiple rounds and killed the man.

properties.name: Alan Huaracha
properties.circumstances: Officers arrived at a residence in response to a call of gunshots. Upon arriving, police allege victim fired a gun at them, to which they returned fire killing the victim.

properties.name: Stephanie Lorraine Browne
properties.circumstances:
From police: deputies responded to a call for a family disturbance, possibly mentally ill person. Upon their arrival, they contacted a female White adult who was armed with a knife. At some point during their interaction, the female charged at the deputies with the knife and a deputy-involved shooting occurred.
Name, age and other details of victim not released as of 4/18/22 JW

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: According to police, victim had stabbed someone on Camellia Drive in Pelham and started going door to door, naked, ringing doorbells and banging on doors. On Honeysuckle Lane an off-duty officer opened their door and engaged the victim, ultimately shooting him

properties.name: Thomas Maisano
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to a call about a person with a knife, and met with victim's mother outside who named her son as the person with the knife, who was inside with his aunt. Officers encountered the victim in the residence and were allegedly unable to convince him to drop the weapon and leave. A police officer then deployed his Taser and shortly after allegedly witnessed the the victim stab his aunt. The officer then discharged his firearm, killing the victim

properties.name: Travis Boawn
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a domestic violence report when the deputies allege they encountered victim outside and he threw a hammer at them. He then fled, and while searching they allege the victim ran at officers with another hammer raised above his head when officers fired their weapons in response, killing the man.

properties.name: Alexander Kade Lanier
properties.circumstances: Officer observed someone steal a car at gunpoint and flee. A vehicle chase ensured during which police allege multiple shots were fired from the victim's car. Officers later shot and killed victim at an intersection.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police on scene after a call from a man who said he shot his wife. Victim and police exchange fire. Unclear whether victim died by police fire or self-inflicted.

properties.name: Andrew Stratton
properties.circumstances: Deputies were responding to a call from victim's father that he had been assaulted by his son, who was in his basement and possibly armed. Officer shot the victim during active negotiations inside the home. Weapons were found near the victim but undetermined if they were ever armed.

properties.name: Terry Edwin Moser
properties.circumstances: Responding to a call about a suicidal man trying to cut their own throat, police encountered victim covered in blood and armed with a knife. He allegedly would not drop the weapon and lunged at officers, when they fired the shots that killed him

properties.name: Blain Johnson
properties.circumstances: Police were called when a vehicle was stolen from a parking lot with children inside. Suspect returned the car quickly, then fled the area on foot. Police were then contacted about someone matching the description stealing a second car. Upon locating that vehicle police allege they initiated a traffic stop and the victim drove away, eventually fleeing the vehicle on foot and showing a weapon. Officers shot the victim during the resulting chase.

properties.name: Brandon Combs
properties.circumstances: An officer allege that they observed the victim trying to steal a vehicle. Approaching him and having ignored multiple commands to stop, a physical struggle ensued, during which the officer shot the suspect.  Body cam footage has been showing to the family but not released to the public.  In the footage the officer fires 5 times and hits Combs, calls in the report, and then fires again.
