After later identifying the vehicle while it was stopped, police approached the car and allege that, after the driver refused refusing to exit the vehicle, they reached inside the car and the driver tried to drive away. In response, officer fired their gun and killed the driver.

properties.name: Joseph Sanchez
properties.circumstances: Police responding to a call of erratic behavior and welfare check contacted victim but he walked away. Officers shortly after fired shots that killed victim.

properties.name: Victim Not Identified
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to calls of an armed man knocking on doors in the apartment complex. Upon encountering the man described, officers allege they did no comply with multiple commands, after which officers fired on the victim.

properties.name: Dustin Booth
properties.circumstances: Police responded to victim's residence after his wife called 911 about a person in mental health crisis. Victim would not leave his home and police worked with a friend to have them drive him away from the home and then pull over for police. Booth was not aware of this arrangement and once stopped exited the car. Police, believing him to have a gun on him, used dogs, then physically attempted to arrest him. Police allege the victim then pulled his gun out which is when he was shot by officers. Family and witnesses dispute police accounts.

properties.name: Terrell Russell
properties.circumstances: City police and US Marshalls were executing an arrest warrant at victim's residence when he allegedly opened the door armed with gun. After a brief and unsuccessful attempt to negotiate surrender, officers shot and killed the man.

properties.name: Hunter Tice
properties.circumstances: Responding to calls of a car that had struck multiple parked vehicles, officers encountered the victim locked in his truck holding a knife to his own chest. After unsuccessful negotiations, victim allegedly exited his vehicle holding the knife and moving toward officers when multiple shots were fired.

properties.name: Aian Thomas Tracy
properties.circumstances: The police were called for a welfare check and the police encountered the suspect with a hatchet. The police killed him in response.

properties.name: Makari Smith
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call about someone with known mental health issues experiencing a breakdown. Upon arriving at the residence, the victim allegedly was armed with a gun and, when shooting it once away from officers, was shot and killed by police.

properties.name: Deven Karl Moore
properties.circumstances: The Kern County Sheriff’s Office said deputies opened fire and killed a suspect who attempted to take someone hostage during an incident in Oildale.

properties.name: Jose De Jesus Montoya Villa
properties.circumstances: Police officials say a suspect is responsible for a crime spree in Aurora. Suspect was wanted for a deadly shooting at a church last week. Shots fired on Dayton Street at around 3:40 p.m. It evolved to a carjacking at gunpoint and subsequent hit and run. Officers spotted the vehicle near Broncos Parkway and Parker Road. They say the suspect was armed and police fired shots at Montoya Villa.

properties.name: Randy Lansang
properties.circumstances: Officers swarmed an area at the intersection of U.S. 1 and Beville Road. Police said they were following the man earlier in the evening before the fatal shooting. Police said the man wouldn’t get out of the car so a K-9 went to drag him out. Police said it looked like the man reached for a gun and officers fired at him.

properties.name: Jayden Prunty
properties.circumstances: Patrolling officer allege they encountered victim walking on the street and could smell marijuana from their vehicle and ordered him to stop. Officers allege that victim refused to stop and was physically brought to the ground. A shot was fired while officer was on top of victim, after which an officer pulled off and fired his weapon.

properties.name: Brian W. Schneider
properties.circumstances: According to Mesa Police, the incident began during the early-morning hours of Feb. 8 when a 36-year-old man, subsequently identified as Brian W. Schneider, showed up at his parent's house, located in the area of Dobson Road and University Drive.

properties.name: Steve Neff
properties.circumstances: One man is dead after pulling a weapon on a Corpus Christi Police Officer late Tuesday night.

properties.name: Daniel Joseph Spisso Jr
properties.circumstances: Carter County Sheriff's Office received a report of shots fired at a home on Garland Road in Roan Mountain. A release from the TBI says the person began actively shooting at deputies upon their arrival. The deputies exchanged fire, the TBI reported. Victim died two days after.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Deputies responding to a call about disturbance by a person shooting a gun.  Upon arrival they encountered the victim in front of a home allegedly actively firing the gun. The victim allegedly aimed the gun at deputies who then shot and killed them.

properties.name: Troy Eames
properties.circumstances: The victim was the son of the deputy that shot him before also killing himself. it is believed that the officer was distraught while being investigated for grand larceny.

properties.name: Emilio Chamizo
properties.circumstances: He was repeatedly instructed to put the weapon down and didn't listen. Chamizo raised the weapon and started walking toward the officers, so one officer shot him, Krynsky said.

properties.name: Richard  Meyers
properties.circumstances: Law enforcement tried to pull Meyers over, he sped away, was eventually boxed in, he appeared to point a rifle at officers who then shot him in Northgate Park. The video footage shows officers following the shoots being fired waiting behind a Salem Police car and repeatedly yelling at Meyers to "show" his hands, get out of the car and lay on the ground. Meyers repeatedly yells that he can't do those things because he's been shot. He screams and pleads for help several times, twice yelling "I can't breathe."  "I'm dying," he yells back to police at one point. Police said they later provided first aid to Meyers, who was taken to Salem Hospital. He died of his injuries at the hospital.

properties.name: Shawn W. Wilson
properties.circumstances: A family is searching for answers after their loved one was shot and killed by Kansas City, Missouri, police officers earlier this week.

properties.name: James David Fanning
properties.circumstances: Greenville police responded to a disturbance between tenants at the Ranch View apartments at about 5:55 p.m., according to a City of Greenville news release. At about 9:24 p.m., officers were dispatched to the same area of the Ranch View Apartments in reference to a report of shots being fired. It was discovered that a man was discharging both a rifle and a handgun, according to the news release.

properties.name: Anthony Parker
properties.circumstances: Stopped by a DPS trooper near Interstate 10 and Orange Grove Road in reference to a "person to locate" call from the Yuma area. According to MPD, a stand-off between Parker and the trooper occurred after law enforcement officials learned that the 48-year-old was reportedly armed with a firearm and had intentions to harm himself. During the hours-long standoff, Parker was shot by the trooper and was pronounced dead shortly after arriving at a local hospital.

properties.name: Charion Lockett
properties.circumstances: There was a warrant for the victim's arrest — about an hour before officers fatally shot Charion Lockett, a criminal justice graduate studying for law school. Authorities said the shooting happened when Charion Lockett allegedly opened fire on police from a parked car in the family home driveway and that firearms were recovered. The family and attorney are refuting the account of the story and are requesting a release of the body cam footage.

properties.name: Jason D. Ickler
properties.circumstances: The Sheriff’s Office says Ickler jumped from a window when deputies located his room, and entered a vehicle in the hotel parking lot. Authorities say when a deputy approached the vehicle, Ickler accelerated towards the deputy. The deputy then discharged his duty weapon while trying to avoid being struck by the vehicle.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances:
The preliminary investigation found that a separate person at the home had attempted to shoot someone, and an arrest warrant was obtained.

Troopers attempted to serve the arrest warrant, but the person was uncooperative and refused to leave the home.

properties.name: Troy Allen Bain
properties.circumstances: Police were serving the victim an Emergency Custody Order. Police state that the victim was not cooperating with the police and brandished a gun. Police shot and killed the victim after the victim reportedly failed to obey commands.

properties.name: Robert Langley
properties.circumstances: The Georgetown County Sheriff’s Office said the chase was initiated by an officer with the Hemingway Police Department in Williamsburg County that led into Georgetown County, ending in a crash.  The video shows the officer did not have a valid reason to initiate a traffic stop.

properties.name: Michael Shane Carver
properties.circumstances: The man who was shot and killed by a Lincoln County Sheriff’s deputy after dragging him through a field while fleeing a traffic stop has been identified.

properties.name: Brenton Chambers
properties.circumstances: The state Office of Inspector General is investigating after a man who was in Norwich police custody died in a holding cell on Feb. 4.

properties.name: Phillip Dill
properties.circumstances: Victim is alleged to have called the police and stated that he was losing his mind and intended to kill people. Responding officers claim that they encountered a hostage situation between the victim and multiple other people and, after negotiations allegedly failed, shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Andrew John
properties.circumstances: Members of a U.S. Marshals task force shot and killed an Aniak man Friday after he shot and wounded a deputy U.S. marshal during efforts to apprehend him on a felony arrest warrant, Alaska State Troopers said.

properties.name: Isaiah Perez
properties.circumstances: The victim allegedly robbed two victims outdoors of $22 and rode away on his bicycle wearing a ski mask. Officers responding to the incidents in vehicles and helicopter support later located the victim. After a short chase, officers engaged and were giving verbal commands to the suspect. The victim allegedly drew a gun and three officers fired upon him,

properties.name: Nicholas Rodin
properties.circumstances: The victim called 911 requesting to be picked up and stated he had a gun and knife on him. He allegedly refused to follow commands and allegedly reached toward his pocket when he was shot.

properties.name: Amir Locke
properties.circumstances: Amir Locke was fatally shot by Minneapolis police officers in an apartment early Wednesday morning as officers were executing a "no-knock" search warrant.

properties.name: Jonathan Murillo-Nix
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a call about a suspect armed with a knife. When officers arrived, victim allegedly came outside and "charged" officers with a knife. Police initially used a bean bag weapon, and then shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Joseph Wayne Butler
properties.circumstances: In an apartment complex

properties.name: Michael J. Trappett
properties.circumstances: Deputies were dispatched to respond to an call about an intoxicated person armed with a knife. Deputies believed the victim to be the subject. Officers reported that they encountered the the victim who allegedly was holding the knife. The victim was allegedly not responding to verbal commands before they shot and killed him.

properties.name: Michael Haas
properties.circumstances: Mishawaka Officer Garrett Schock shot and killed 37-year-old Michael Haas after he fired at Schock.

properties.name: Dyonta Quarles Jr.
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call from a resident indicating they were having an argument with their son, and he would not allow her to leave a bedroom. Officers entered the home and encountered the victim in an interior room and as they went to detain him, the victim allegedly began a violent assault of officers. During the subsequent altercation, an officer deployed a taser and then fired their gun, killing him.

properties.name: Joon Han
properties.circumstances: Police called to the residence around 5 a.m. on reports of a shooting. Officers arrived and found a man and a woman dead inside of the home. Early investigation revealed the incident was a domestic murder-suicide. Reports that woman was girlfriend.

properties.name: Abigail Bieber
properties.circumstances: Victim was a deputy who was killed in a domestic dispute by her partner, an off-duty detective.

properties.name: Donald Sahota
properties.circumstances: An armed robbery suspect was being pursued by officers and ran to the victim's home nearby. The victim held the suspect at gunpoint until he was stabbed by the robbery suspect. Officers arrived as the wounded victim began pursuing the suspect. Police then shot and killed the victim, allegedly thinking that he was the robbery suspect.

properties.name: Jerome Holman
properties.circumstances: Officers were responding to reports of a man, the victim, sleeping in vehicle. Officers reported that they believed it was a stolen vehicle. When they approached the victim, and opened the door, the victim reportedly sped away and towards the police cruiser. Officers fired weapons.

properties.name: Landon Eastep
properties.agency_responsible: Tennessee Highway Patrol,Mt. Juliet Police Department
properties.circumstances: Highway patrol stopped after seeing victim sitting on a guardrail along the highway and allegedly offered him a ride. Victim allegedly pushed trooper and brandished a box cutter. Another officer driving by stopped to help, when victim allegedly pulled out a "metal cylindrical object" at which point officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: Wesley Chance
properties.circumstances: Chase between police and victim began for unreported reasons. Victim eventually crashed and is alleged to have fled on foot. Officers claim that victim was holding a handgun, and one officer fired, killing him.

properties.name: John Paul Romero
properties.circumstances: The police claim that Romero came home from work upset with the dogs and began attacking the dogs and family members intervened. He then attacked the family members, they allege. The family then called 911 while fighting him back. The police arrived and the man attempted to attack the police with a machete and the police killed him in response.

properties.name: Equan Hospon
properties.circumstances: Responding to a 911 call about suspicious people in a vehicle, police arrived and identified the same vehicle as one being linked to a homicide earlier that day at the Royal Palace Club. Officers attempted to stop the vehicle, and allege that the driver then attempted to flee and then lost control of the vehicle. The driver and three other occupants then left the vehicle running and at least one suspect exchanged fire with police. One suspect was shot and two officers were injured in the exchange. Two of the three surviving suspects were arrested shortly after the shooting: August Burns, 23, and Clyde Thomas, 35. The third suspect, 23-year-old Johnny Lewis, was arrested more than six weeks later on March 11 in the Las Vegas area.

properties.name: Peterson Kamo
properties.circumstances: Police called to domestic violence scene.  When police arrived the victim was allegedly holding a knife with a toddler in his arms.  Police shot him.

properties.name: Bradley James Ellison
properties.circumstances: Police received a call about a suspicious person. When police arrived, the victim allegedly began shooting at the police. Police returned fire and the victim was killed.

properties.name: Amanda Alvarez-Calo
properties.circumstances: An off-duty officer allegedly shot and killed the victim, his wife, and then himself.

properties.name: Paul Courtemanche
properties.circumstances: The victim called 911 for help and explained that he had a knife and was having a mental health crisis. When officers arrived, the victim allegedly came towards the officers with the knife. One officer fired a non-lethal projectile and another officer fired their service weapon. The victim was pronounced dead at the hospital

properties.name: Bobby Lee Sutton
properties.circumstances: Off-duty deputy allegedly saw a man on his ring breaking into his house. He saw the victim nearby and followed him into the woods where he then proceeded to have an "altercation" and shot the victim.

properties.name: Christopher "Chris" Jones
properties.circumstances: Police found victim sleeping in car. The police reported that when trying to get the victim's attention and spotted a handgun in the front seat, the victim reversed into a police vehicle and officers fired and killed the victim.

properties.name: Jeffrey Thomas
properties.circumstances: An officer attempted a traffic stop for a minor infraction. The victim allegedly sped off and led police on an extended chase. An officer used a PIT maneuver at high speeds, causing the car to crash and kill the driver.

properties.name: Francisco Junior Lopez
properties.agency_responsible: Texas Department of Public Safety ,Lavaca County Sheriff Department,Yoakum Police Department,Hallettsville Police Department
properties.circumstances: Officers attempt to pull over the victim, but the victim fled by car, and then by foot, before entering a home and taking someone hostage.  Following unsuccessful negotiations, officers allege the victim put the hostage in danger, and shot the victim, killing him.

properties.name: Dedrick Garcia
properties.circumstances: Victim was allegedly violating traffic laws and speeding. Police chased the victim until the victim stopped, turned off the lights of his vehicle, and proceeded to barricade himself inside his car. Officers attempted to remove the victim but he was not responsive.Officers alleged the victim had a weapon. After releasing projectiles into the car, one officer alleged that the victim was pulling for a firearm and the officers fire there weapons.

properties.name: Lashawn McNeil
properties.circumstances: NYPD officers responding to a 911 call reportedly were fired upon by the victim when entering. One officer was killed and another is in critical condition. McNeil exhcanged fire with a third officer who shot McNeil. McNeil became brain dead and died later at the hospital.

properties.name: Yoskar Feliz
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a burglary at a residence. The individual fled the scene, and police reportedly found a man with a gun in the area. Police claim the man refused to drop the gun, and an officer deployed their taser. Police claim the individual then shot at officers and ran on foot. Police chased the individual to a park and claim the individual turned towards police with the gun still in hand. Police shot the individual, and police allege the individual then jumped into the Bronx River. Police got the individual out of the water, and the person died.

properties.name: Nelson Szeto
properties.circumstances: Polcie responded to multiple calls regarding a "suspicious individual" at a BART terminal at the San Francisco International Airport. Upon arrival, police claim the individual brandished two firearms. Police used non-lethal measures and claim the individual advanced towards officers. Police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Charles Stanley
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a domestic violence assault. Upon arrival, they found a man and a woman engaged in an argument that reportedly turned physical. The woman fled the residence and called the police. Police determined they had probable cause to arrest the man. Police claim that when they attempted to take the man into custody he brandished a handgun. Police allege the individual fired the gun at officers. Police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Ronald W. Flowers II
properties.circumstances: Police were on foot patrol and encountered a "suspicious person." Police approached the individual, Flowers, and claim he shot at deputies. Two deputies returned fire, killing Flowers.

properties.name: Robert Seth Carter
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a "major traffic collision" that a supposed carjacking suspect had caused. Upon arrival, police allege an individual began shooting at them. Police returned fire, shooting and killing the individual.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.agency_responsible: "Riverside County Sheriff's Office, Hemet Police Department, Riverside Police Department"
properties.circumstances: Police were conducting surveillance on an individual related to the distribution of fentanyl. Police attempted to contact the individual and allege they fled on foot. Police followed, and claim the individual was armed with a firearm. Police deployed less-lethal munitions, and allege they were not "successful." Police then shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Tyler M. Marler
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man with a gun. Upon arrival, police claim the individual pointed a BB gun at officers. Police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Victim was reportedly wielding a knife and making moves towards the firefighters and acting "erratically." Officers fired their firearms.

properties.name: Nathan Humphrey
properties.circumstances: Victim was suspect to a homicide. Sheriff's came across victim and he started to run. The deputies reported that while he was running it seemed he was armed and pointing a weapon towards them. Deputies shot victim, victim was pronounced dead at the hospital

properties.name: Moses Portillo
properties.circumstances: A deputy pulled a vehicle over for a traffic stop for an unknown reason. The deputy shot and killed a passenger in the vehicle. Police are withholding all additional details at this time.

properties.name: Junnie Williams
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a vehicle break-in. The police came across the victim who they suspected to "fit the profile." The victim fled. The officers reported that the victim was armed and shot the victim. Victim was pronounced dead at the hospital.

properties.name: Ismael Montes
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call from a resident who claimed a man was making threats of violence against other individuals in the residence and was refusing to leave. Police claim the person was armed with an edged weapon and allegedly refused to drop it. Police deployed less-lethal rounds at the individual, who they claim retreated further into the residence. Police then allege the individual "charged at them" while "swinging the weapon." Two officers shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Miguel Maldonado
properties.circumstances: During a domestic violence incident the victim's car, with his wife and daughter inside, crashed and ended up in a river. When police arrived victim was allegedly holding a knife asking that police shoot him and threatening his wife. Police shot and killed him in response.

properties.name: Steffon Griffin
properties.circumstances: The victim allegedly attacked officers with knives after they tried to arrest him for violating a protective order. An officer shot once, killing the victim.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to a report of a man assaulting someone in a parked car. Deputies allege they were unable to stop the assault until they used a taser on the victim. Shortly after detaining the victim, he became unresponsive and was taken to a hospital where he was pronounced dead.

properties.name: Raishawn Jones
properties.agency_responsible: "Duke University Police Department, Durham Police Department"
properties.circumstances: A man was in police custody and receiving treatment for unknown reasons at Duke University Hospital. At some point, police allege the individual got into a scuffle with a Durham Police officer and got the officer's gun. A Duke University Police Department officer responded to the scene. The Duke officer shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Barry Dean Compton
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a call from someone saying that the suspect was threatening to kill them. When the police arrived, the suspect allegedly refused to drop his weapon after engaging with the police and the police killed him.

properties.name: Edgar Morfin Mendoza
properties.circumstances: Police were called to the Meux Home Museum on reports of an individual reportedly "pacing franticly" outside. Upon arrival, police claim the windows of the museum were broke, the front door pried open, and an individual in the building. Police tased the individual, who they claim pulled the prongs out. Police allege the individual then raised a hammer and came towards officer. Two officers shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Alexander Bogusz
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of an intoxicated man allegedly armed with a gun inside a Carl's Jr. restaurant. Upon arrival, police attempted to talk to the individual and claim the person pointed a gun at an officer. Police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Charles Walker Piquet
properties.circumstances: A man had cut his own neck then began stabbing a gas station clerk before he was shot and killed by Durham police on Wednesday, a warrant says.

properties.name: Michael Neuman
properties.circumstances: FBI agents were on a court-authorized law enforcement operation and shot and killed an individual. The agency is withholding all additional details at this time.

properties.name: Michael Scott Meridith
properties.circumstances: Officers responded to a report of attempted break-in. On arrival, victim is alleged to have rushed at responding officers with a tire iron, striking one. Officers shot and killed the victim.

properties.name: Kenneth Delton Hutcheson
properties.circumstances: Police in Arvada shot and killed the victim. The victim reportedly had a knife and started to come towards the officers. Two officers fired their weapons and the victim was pronounced dead at the scene.

properties.name: Jose Daniel Argueta Turcios
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a car crash in which one individual was reportedly intoxicated and allegedly armed with a knife. Police tased the individual, and then shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Megan Joyce Mohn
properties.circumstances: An off-duty officer, and later an on-duty officer responded to a report of someone suspicious walking outside and carrying a rebar. When police engaged the victim, she was allegedly yelling and attempted to flee. Officers captured and pinned the victim on the ground before forcing them into the hogtie position for multiple minutes. The victim became non-responsive and died days later in the hospital.

properties.name: Isaiah Tyree Williams
properties.circumstances: Las Vegas police say dozens of rounds were fired during a deadly shootout on Monday morning that began when officers were executing a search warrant related to a 2021 homicide investigation. 19-year-old Isaiah Tyree Williams was shot and killed during the incident around 5 a.m. Police say he is not the homicide suspect and that the homicide suspect was not in the building at the time, though they say they were inside the correct apartment.

properties.name: Isaac Andrade
properties.circumstances: Officers shot a robbery suspect who pulled a replica gun on them in an alley two blocks from liquor store.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.agency_responsible: "US Marshals, San Bernardino County Sheriff's Office"
properties.circumstances: Police were looking for an attempted murder suspect. Police located the individual in a vehicle in a parking lot. Police claim the individual refused to exit the vehicle. Police deployed less lethal rounds, and allege the individual got out of the car armed with a knife. Police claim the individual charged at officers with the knife and police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Denrick Demond Stallings
properties.circumstances: Deputy William Owenby attempted to conduct a traffic stop as Stallings was reportedly speeding. Owenby claims Stallings refused to stop and led them on a pursuit. Stallings eventually crashed his vehicle, and reportedly exited the vehicle and ran away from Owenby. Owenby used a taser on Stallings, causing him to fall to the ground. Owenby attempted to take Stallings into custody and claims a struggle for his gun ensued. Owenby shot and killed Stallings. Owenby shot and killed a man in May 2020 during a similar situation, beginning with a car chase.

properties.name: Orlando Taylor III
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of Taylor allegedly threatening someone with a knife in the street. Police pursued Taylor on foot. Police claim Taylor went towards officers with a knife in his hand. At some point Taylor reportedly stabbed a police officer. Police shot and killed Taylor.

properties.name: Luis A. Ku Huitzil
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man inside a mobile home armed with knives. The individual reportedly set a fire in the home. Police fired 40mm less lethal rounds at the individual. Police then shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of an individual who entered a gas station convenience store with a knife and hands covered in blood. Police allege the individual charged at officers with a large knife. Police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Jason Walker
properties.circumstances: Deputy Jeffrey Hash claims Walker jumped on his vehicle and broke his windshield. Hash shot and killed Walker. Hash was off-duty at the time.  Autopsy revealed that Walker was shot 4 times.

properties.name: Deaughn Willis
properties.circumstances: Police went to an apartment complex looking for an alleged kidnapping suspect. Never announcing themselves, a group of police with weapons out knocked aggressively on a residence's door multiple times. Afraid, the family gathered the children in the rear of the home and a female inside phoned 9110 about aggressive knocks when the door was opened. Police reportedly encountered the victim as he opened the door after multiple knock attempts and claim the victim brandished a firearm. A deputy shot and killed Willis.

properties.name: Courtney Spraggins
properties.circumstances: The victim was pregnant with officer's (her boyfriend) baby and visited the officer, who shot and killed her in his apartment parking lot while off-duty.

properties.name: Todd Fiepke
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man carrying a shotgun in the street. Upon arrival, police allege Fiepke fired the shotgun into the air. Police claim Fiepke refused to put the gun down. Police shot and killed Fiepke. Fiepke's partner stated Fiepke had a number of mental health issues.

properties.name: James Sutton
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a robbery in progress at a local pharmacy. Upon arrival, police reportedly encountered Sutton holding a knife. Police claim one officer was stabbed by Sutton. Police officers Jillian Putkowski, Christopher Rogan, and Richard Johnson shot and killed Sutton.

properties.name: Jose Brito Lopez
properties.circumstances: Police were responding to a burglary in progress and it was reported the burglar was armed with a knife. Police encountered victim in the residence and he allegedly kept approaching officers and not complying with commands when he was shot and killed.

properties.name: Ricardo Otero
properties.circumstances: Victim's father called 911 claiming victim was trying to break into his house with a knife. Police arrived and encountered victim, who allegedly charged at them with a knife, which resulted in the officer shooting the victim, killing him.

properties.name: Abdul Timmons
properties.circumstances: A Florence County deputy shot and killed Abdul Timmons during a supposed foot chase. Deputies claim Timmons was armed at the time. Police are withholding all additional details at this time.

properties.name: Tony Edwards
properties.circumstances: Frankfort Police Department officers were in Mayfield helping local agencies with the aftermath of tornadoes. Officers were conducting patrol overnight at the Mayfield-Graves County Fairgrounds when they allege a man armed with a gun approached officers and fired multiple shots in their direction. Officers shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: Name Withheld
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of an allegedly armed woman threatening employees at a Wells Fargo branch. Police shot and killed the individual.

properties.name: JD Javier Lane
properties.circumstances: Officers stopped the victim's vehicle on suspicion of a warrant. The victim fled on foot, leaving 2 other individuals in the car. While fleeing, the victim was shot and killed by officers.

properties.name: Carl Schaede
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of a robbery involving a suspect in a previous domestic disturbance. During the earlier domestic dispute the individual had reportedly injured two individuals. The individual then left the site of the alleged robbery, and went to a community center where he allegedly threatened occupants with a firearm. The individual left the community center, and police eventually caught up to him. Police claim the individual raised a gun at officers, and officers shot and killed him.

properties.name: Roman Ivan Kokhanevych
properties.agency_responsible: "Gresham Police Department, Multnomah County Sheriff's Office"
properties.circumstances: Police were called to an armed robbery happening at a bank. Kokhaneych reportedly fled the scene with an accomplice, Haley Hop. A car chase ensued, ending near the Gresham Station Shopping Center. Police allege Kokhanevych shot at officers multiple times during the chase. At one point, Kokhaneych and Hop reportedly exited the vehicle and carjacked another. Officer Mark Smith and Deputy Chad Phifer opened fire, killing Kokhanevych.

properties.name: Stephanie Wilson
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to reports of a disturbance. Upon arrival, police allegedly observed a woman armed with a shotgun. Deputies claim the woman aimed the weapon at them multiple times. Deputies shot and killed the woman.

properties.name: Vincenzo Rudi
properties.circumstances: An individual reportedly threatened another man with a gun while involved in a fight. The man went to police and reported the individual. Police obtained an arrest warrant, and police found the individual inside a building. When police told him to come out, the individually allegedly fired three shots at SWAT officers. At least one officer opened fire, killing the individual.

properties.name: Caleb Stanford
properties.circumstances: Police received two calls concerning a man armed with a knife. Upon arrival, police reportedly encountered Stanford with an 8-inch kitchen knife. Police claim that Stanford walked towards them while holding the knife. Stanford was compliant with officers' commands. Officers claim he then went at officers "aggressively" with the knife. Stanford reportedly began to lie down on his stomach but did not drop the knife. Police allege Stanford jumped up and went towards officers while still holding the knife. Police shot and killed Stanford.

properties.name: Charles Corey Castro
properties.circumstances: Deputies were called to an address to serve a civil protection order on Castro. The protection order was filed by Castro's wife, requiring him to move out of their home. When deputies told Castro that he needed to leave, he reportedly became agitated. Deputies claim Castro charged at deputies with a weapon. Deputies told Castro to drop the weapon, and he reportedly refused. Deputies shot and killed Castro.

properties.name: James Schild
properties.circumstances: Police responded to reports of an "erratic" man jumping fences. Upon arrival, police encountered Schild allegedly holding a "large metal object" in his hand. Police used bean-bag guns and tasers to take Schild into custody. Police allege Schild lunged at police, and two officers shot and killed Schild.

properties.name: Matthew Elston
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to reports of a suicidal man. The man stated that he had a gun, was suicidal, and at a home attempting to contact another occupant. During transit, deputies reportedly learned that the individual had fired shots at the location. Upon arrival, deputies shot and killed the man.

properties.name: Kadeem Errol Livingston Smith
properties.circumstances: Deputies responded to a domestic violence call. Deputies claim they witnessed a man shoot and pistol whip his father before allegedly opening fire on the officers. Deputies shot and killed Smith.

properties.name: James Williams
properties.circumstances: Williams was firing an AR15 rifle toward the sky in celebration of the new year. Police arrived at the residence and fired at Williams through a privacy fence. Video from the incident confirms the police did not announce their presence or provide any warning. Police shot and killed Williams.

properties.name: Michael Dobbins
properties.circumstances: Police responded to a domestic disturbance call. Dobbins had reportedly broken into a vehicle and stolen a weapon earlier in the day. Dobbins allegedly then broke into a home, assaulted a residence, and threatened to kill another resident. Dobbins then fled the area prior to deputies arriving. Deputies received additional calls of Dobbins firing shots at a passing vehicle. Deputies eventually located Dobbins and claim he pointed a weapon at polcie. Deputies shot and killed Dobbins.
